  7190 0000226F 803E[7500]1A            		cmp	byte [drvmax], 26 ; checks for drvmax < 26
  7191 00002274 720D                    		jb	short dmax_ok	; return with carry if okay
  7192 00002276 06                      		push	es
  7193                                  		;mov	ax, 46Dh	; SYSINIT_SEG (SYSINIT segment)
  7194 00002277 B85804                  		mov	ax, SYSINITSEG	; 17/10/2022	
  7195 0000227A 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  7196                                  		; 18/10/2022
  7197 0000227C 26C606[FF03]01          		mov	byte [es:TOOMANYDRIVESFLAG], 1 ; 09/12/2022 
  7198                                  		;mov	byte ptr es:3FFh, 1 ; [es:toomanydrivesflag]
  7199                                  					; set message flag
  7200                                  					; [SYSINIT+toomanydrivesflag]
  7201 00002282 07                      		pop	es
  7202                                  
  7203                                  		;;push	es
  7204                                  		;;mov	ax,SYSINIT_SEG
  7205                                  		;;mov	es,ax
  7206                                  		;;mov	byte [es:toomanydrivesflag],1
  7207                                  					; set message flag
  7208                                  		;;pop	es
  7209                                  		;
  7210                                  		;mov	byte [SYSINIT+toomanydrivesflag],1
  7211                                  dmax_ok:				
  7212 00002283 C3                      		retn
  7213                                  
  7214                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7215                                  
  7216                                  ; 18/10/2022
  7217                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7218                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0						
  7219                                  ;								 
  7220                                  ;	link next bds (at ds:di) into the chain. assume that the
  7221                                  ;	  chain is entirely within ds == datagrp. also update drvmax,
  7222                                  ;	  dskdrv_table, and end_of_bdss.	
  7223                                  
  7224                                  xinstall_bds:		
  7225 00002284 56                      		push	si
  7226 00002285 53                      		push	bx
  7227 00002286 8B36[1901]              		mov	si, [start_bds]	; get first bds
  7228                                  xinstall_bds_1:				
  7229 0000228A 833CFF                  		cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; is this the last one?
  7230 0000228D 7404                    		jz	short xinstall_bds_2 ;	skip ahead if so
  7231                                  		;mov	si, [si+BDS.link]
  7232 0000228F 8B34                    		mov	si, [si]	; chain	through	list
  7233 00002291 EBF7                    		jmp	short xinstall_bds_1
  7234                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7235                                  
  7236                                  xinstall_bds_2:				
  7237                                  		;mov	[si+BDS.link], di
  7238 00002293 893C                    		mov	[si], di
  7239                                  		;mov	[si+BDS.link+2], ds
  7240 00002295 8C5C02                  		mov	[si+2], ds
  7241                                  		;mov	word [di+BDS.link], -1
  7242 00002298 C705FFFF                		mov	word [di], 0FFFFh ; make sure it is a null ptr.
  7243                                  		;mov	[di+BDS.link+2], ds
  7244 0000229C 8C5D02                  		mov	[di+2], ds ; might as well plug segment
  7245                                  		; 20/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7246                                  		;lea	bx, [di+BDS.BPB]
  7247 0000229F 8D5D06                  		lea	bx, [di+6]
  7248 000022A2 8B36[5217]              		mov	si, [last_dskdrv_table]
  7249 000022A6 891C                    		mov	[si], bx
  7250 000022A8 8306[5217]02            		add	word [last_dskdrv_table], 2
  7251 000022AD FE06[7500]              		inc	byte [drvmax]
  7252 000022B1 8306[5417]64            		add	word [end_of_bdss], 100 ; BDS.size = 100
  7253 000022B6 5B                      		pop	bx
  7254 000022B7 5E                      		pop	si
  7255 000022B8 C3                      		retn
  7256                                  
  7257                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7258                                  
  7259                                  ; 17/10/2022
  7260                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7261                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7262                                  ; 03/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  7263                                  
  7264                                  cmos_clock_read:	
  7265 000022B9 50                      		push	ax
  7266 000022BA 51                      		push	cx
  7267 000022BB 52                      		push	dx
  7268 000022BC 55                      		push	bp
  7269 000022BD 31ED                    		xor	bp, bp
  7270                                  loop_clock:				
  7271 000022BF 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  7272 000022C1 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  7273 000022C3 B402                    		mov	ah, 2
  7274 000022C5 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- READ REAL TIME CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  7275                                  					; Return: CH = hours in	BCD
  7276                                  					; CL = minutes in BCD
  7277                                  					; DH = seconds in BCD
  7278 000022C7 83F900                  		cmp	cx, 0
  7279 000022CA 7512                    		jnz	short clock_present
  7280 000022CC 83FA00                  		cmp	dx, 0
  7281 000022CF 750D                    		jnz	short clock_present
  7282 000022D1 83FD01                  		cmp	bp, 1		; read again after a slight delay, in case clock
  7283 000022D4 741C                    		jz	short no_readdate ; was	at zero	setting.
  7284 000022D6 45                      		inc	bp		; only perform delay once.
  7285 000022D7 B90040                  		mov	cx, 4000h	; 16384
  7286                                  delay:					
  7287 000022DA E2FE                    		loop	delay
  7288 000022DC EBE1                    		jmp	short loop_clock
  7289                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7290                                  
  7291                                  clock_present:				
  7292 000022DE 2EC606[F304]01          		mov	byte [cs:havecmosclock], 1 ; set the flag for cmos clock
  7293 000022E4 E81000                  		call	cmosck		; reset	cmos clock rate	that may be
  7294                                  					; possibly destroyed by	cp dos and
  7295                                  					; post routine did not restore that.
  7296 000022E7 56                      		push	si
  7297 000022E8 E83EF2                  		call	read_real_date	; read real-time clock for date
  7298 000022EB FA                      		cli
  7299                                  		;mov	ds:daycnt, si	; set system date
  7300 000022EC 8936[F004]              		mov	[daycnt], si
  7301 000022F0 FB                      		sti
  7302 000022F1 5E                      		pop	si
  7303                                  
  7304                                  no_readdate:				
  7305 000022F2 5D                      		pop	bp
  7306 000022F3 5A                      		pop	dx
  7307 000022F4 59                      		pop	cx
  7308 000022F5 58                      		pop	ax
  7309 000022F6 C3                      		retn
  7310                                  
  7311                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7312                                  
  7313                                  ; the following code is written by jack gulley in engineering group.
  7314                                  ; cp dos (CP/DOS, OS/2) is changing cmos clock rate for its own purposes
  7315                                  ; and if the use cold boot the system to use pc dos while running cp dos,
  7316                                  ; the cmos clock rate are still slow which slow down disk operations
  7317                                  ; of pc dos which uses cmos clock. pc dos is put this code in msinit
  7318                                  ; to fix this problem at the request of cp dos.
  7319                                  ;
  7320                                  ; the program is modified to be run on msinit. equates are defined
  7321                                  ; in cmosequ.inc. this program will be called by cmos_clock_read procedure.
  7322                                  ;
  7323                                  ;  the following code cmosck is used to insure that the cmos has not
  7324                                  ;	had its rate controls left in an invalid state on older at's.
  7325                                  ;
  7326                                  ;	it checks for an at model byte "fc" with a submodel type of
  7327                                  ;	00, 01, 02, 03 or 06 and resets the periodic interrupt rate
  7328                                  ;	bits in case post has not done it. this initilization routine
  7329                                  ;	is only needed once when dos loads. it should be run as soon
  7330                                  ;	as possible to prevent slow diskette access.
  7331                                  ;
  7332                                  ;	this code exposes one to dos clearing cmos setup done by a
  7333                                  ;	resident program that hides and re-boots the system.
  7334                                  
  7335                                  cmosck:					; check and reset rtc rate bits	
  7336                                  
  7337                                  ;model byte and submodel byte were already determined in msinit.
  7338                                  
  7339                                  	; 16/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  7340                                  	; 19/03/2018 (Model: 0FCh, Sub Model: 01h, REF: AMIBIOS Prog. Guide)
  7341                                  			
  7342 000022F7 50                      		push	ax
  7343 000022F8 2E803E[3E06]FC          		cmp	byte [cs:model_byte], 0FCh
  7344 000022FE 7525                    		jnz	short cmosck9	; Exit if not an AT model
  7345 00002300 2E803E[3F06]06          		cmp	byte [cs:secondary_model_byte], 6
  7346                                  					; Is it 06 for the industral AT ?
  7347 00002306 7408                    		jz	short cmosck4	; Go reset CMOS	periodic rate if 06
  7348 00002308 2E803E[3F06]04          		cmp	byte [cs:secondary_model_byte], 4
  7349                                  					; Is it 00, 01, 02, or 03 ?
  7350 0000230E 7315                    		jnb	short cmosck9	; EXIT if problem fixed by POST  
  7351                                  					; Also,Secondary_model_byte = 0 
  7352                                  					;   when AH=0C0h, int 15h failed.
  7353                                  					;	RESET THE CMOS PERIODIC RATE 
  7354                                  					;  Model=FC submodel=00,01,02,03 or 06 
  7355                                  cmosck4:				
  7356 00002310 B08A                    		mov	al, 8Ah		; cmos_reg_a|nmi
  7357                                  					; NMI disabled on return
  7358 00002312 B426                    		mov	ah, 26h		; 00100110b
  7359                                  					; Set divider &	rate selection
  7360 00002314 E83000                  		call	cmos_write
  7361 00002317 B08B                    		mov	al, 8Bh		; cmos_reg_b|nmi
  7362                                  					; NMI disabled on return
  7363 00002319 E80B00                  		call	cmos_read
  7364 0000231C 2407                    		and	al, 7		; 00000111b
  7365                                  					; clear	SET,PIE,AIE,UIE,SQWE
  7366 0000231E 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
  7367 00002320 B00B                    		mov	al, 0Bh		; cmos_reg_b
  7368                                  					; NMI enabled on return
  7369 00002322 E82200                  		call	cmos_write
  7370                                  cmosck9:				
  7371 00002325 58                      		pop	ax
  7372 00002326 C3                      		retn
  7373                                  
  7374                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7375                                  
  7376                                  ;--- CMOS_READ -----------------------------------------------------------------
  7377                                  ;		read byte from cmos system clock configuration table	       :
  7378                                  ;									       :
  7379                                  ; input: (al)=	cmos table address to be read				       :
  7380                                  ;		bit    7 = 0 for nmi enabled and 1 for nmi disabled on exit    :
  7381                                  ;		bits 6-0 = address of table location to read		       :
  7382                                  ;									       :
  7383                                  ; output: (al)	value at location (al) moved into (al). if bit 7 of (al) was   :
  7384                                  ;		on then nmi left disabled.  during the cmos read both nmi and  :
  7385                                  ;		normal interrupts are disabled to protect cmos data integrity. :
  7386                                  ;		the cmos address register is pointed to a default value and    :
  7387                                  ;		the interrupt flag restored to the entry state on return.      :
  7388                                  ;		only the (al) register and the nmi state is changed.	       :
  7389                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7390                                  
  7391                                  cmos_read:				; read location (al) into (al)	
  7392 00002327 9C                      		pushf
  7393 00002328 FA                      		cli
  7394 00002329 53                      		push	bx
  7395 0000232A 50                      		push	ax		; AL = cmos table address to be	read
  7396 0000232B 0C80                    		or	al, 80h
  7397 0000232D E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7398                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7399 0000232F 90                      		nop			; (undocumented	delay needed)
  7400 00002330 E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7401 00002332 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax
  7402 00002334 58                      		pop	ax
  7403 00002335 2480                    		and	al, 80h
  7404 00002337 0C0F                    		or	al, 0Fh
  7405 00002339 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7406                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7407 0000233B 90                      		nop
  7408 0000233C E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7409 0000233E 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  7410 00002340 5B                      		pop	bx
  7411 00002341 0E                      		push	cs		; *place code segment in stack and
  7412 00002342 E80100                  		call	cmos_popf	; *handle popf for b- level 80286
  7413 00002345 C3                      		retn			; return with flags restored
  7414                                  
  7415                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7416                                  
  7417                                  cmos_popf:				
  7418 00002346 CF                      		iret			; popf for level b- parts
  7419                                  					; return far and restore flags
  7420                                  
  7421                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7422                                  
  7423                                  ;--- cmos_write ----------------------------------------------------------------
  7424                                  ;		write byte to cmos system clock configuration table	       :
  7425                                  ;									       :
  7426                                  ; input: (al)=	cmos table address to be written to			       :
  7427                                  ;		bit    7 = 0 for nmi enabled and 1 for nmi disabled on exit    :
  7428                                  ;		bits 6-0 = address of table location to write		       :
  7429                                  ;	 (ah)=	new value to be placed in the addressed table location	       :
  7430                                  ;									       :
  7431                                  ; output:	value in (ah) placed in location (al) with nmi left disabled   :
  7432                                  ;		if bit 7 of (al) is on. during the cmos update both nmi and    :
  7433                                  ;		normal interrupts are disabled to protect cmos data integrity. :
  7434                                  ;		the cmos address register is pointed to a default value and    :
  7435                                  ;		the interrupt flag restored to the entry state on return.      :
  7436                                  ;		only the cmos location and the nmi state is changed.	       :
  7437                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7438                                  
  7439                                  cmos_write:				; write (ah) to location (al)	
  7440 00002347 9C                      		pushf			; write (ah) to location (al)
  7441 00002348 50                      		push	ax		; save work register values
  7442 00002349 FA                      		cli
  7443 0000234A 50                      		push	ax		; save user nmi	state
  7444 0000234B 0C80                    		or	al, 80h		; disable nmi for us
  7445 0000234D E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7446                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7447 0000234F 90                      		nop
  7448 00002350 88E0                    		mov	al, ah
  7449 00002352 E671                    		out	71h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7450 00002354 58                      		pop	ax		; get user nmi
  7451 00002355 2480                    		and	al, 80h
  7452 00002357 0C0F                    		or	al, 0Fh
  7453 00002359 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7454                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7455 0000235B 90                      		nop
  7456 0000235C E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7457 0000235E 58                      		pop	ax		; restore work registers
  7458 0000235F 0E                      		push	cs		; *place code segment in stack and
  7459 00002360 E8E3FF                  		call	cmos_popf	; *handle popf for b- level 80286
  7460 00002363 C3                      		retn
  7461                                  
  7462                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7463                                  ; MSINIT.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  7464                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7465                                  ; The following routines provide support for reading in the file MSDOS.SYS.
  7466                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7467                                  
  7468                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7469                                  ;
  7470                                  ; (For Retro DOS, 'IO.SYS' and 'MSDOS.SYS' are already loaded together
  7471                                  ;  at once -as single kernel file- by the Retro DOS boot sector code.
  7472                                  ;  So, following disk reads -MSDOS.SYS loading- is not needed!
  7473                                  ;  Only needing is to move MSDOS Kernel to it's final memory location.) 
  7474                                  
  7475                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7476                                  
  7477                                  ; GetClus, read in a cluster at a specified address
  7478                                  ;
  7479                                  ;  bx = cluster to read
  7480                                  ;  cx = sectors per cluster
  7481                                  ;  es:di = load location
  7482                                  
  7483                                  ; 17/10/2022
  7484                                  ;DISKRD equ diskrd - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h	; (8E5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7485                                  ; 09/12/2022
  7486                                  DISKRD equ diskrd
  7487                                  
  7488                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7489                                  getclus:				
  7490 00002364 51                      		push	cx
  7491 00002365 57                      		push	di
  7492 00002366 2E890E[D016]            		mov	[cs:doscnt], cx
  7493 0000236B 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  7494 0000236D 48                      		dec	ax
  7495 0000236E 48                      		dec	ax
  7496 0000236F F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to logical sector
  7497                                  					; dx:ax	= matching logical sector number
  7498                                  					;	  starting from the data sector
  7499 00002371 2E0306[CC16]            		add	ax, [cs:bios_l]
  7500 00002376 2E1316[CE16]            		adc	dx, [cs:bios_h]	; dx:ax	= first	logical	sector to read
  7501                                  unpack:					
  7502 0000237B 1E                      		push	ds
  7503 0000237C 50                      		push	ax
  7504 0000237D 53                      		push	bx
  7505 0000237E 2E8B36[D316]            		mov	si, [cs:fatloc]
  7506 00002383 8EDE                    		mov	ds, si
  7507 00002385 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; next cluster
  7508 00002387 2EF606[D216]40          		test	byte [cs:fbigfat], 40h	; fbig
  7509                                  					; 16 bit fat?
  7510 0000238D 753C                    		jnz	short unpack16	; yes
  7511 0000238F D1EE                    		shr	si, 1		; 12 bit fat. si=si/2
  7512                                  					; si = clus + clus/2
  7513 00002391 01DE                    		add	si, bx		;
  7514                                  					; (si =	byte offset of the cluster in the FAT)
  7515 00002393 52                      		push	dx
  7516 00002394 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  7517 00002396 E87C00                  		call	get_fat_sector
  7518 00002399 5A                      		pop	dx
  7519 0000239A 8B07                    		mov	ax, [bx]	; save it into ax
  7520 0000239C 7517                    		jnz	short even_odd	; if not a splitted fat, check even-odd.
  7521                                  		; 25/06/2023
  7522                                  		;mov	al, [bx]	; splitted fat
  7523 0000239E 2EA2[DA16]              		mov	[cs:temp_cluster], al
  7524 000023A2 46                      		inc	si		; (next	byte)
  7525 000023A3 52                      		push	dx
  7526 000023A4 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  7527 000023A6 E86C00                  		call	get_fat_sector
  7528 000023A9 5A                      		pop	dx
  7529                                  		;mov	al, ds:0
  7530 000023AA A00000                  		mov	al, [0] ; 19/10/2022
  7531 000023AD 2EA2[DB16]              		mov	[cs:temp_cluster+1], al
  7532 000023B1 2EA1[DA16]              		mov	ax, [cs:temp_cluster]
  7533                                  even_odd:				
  7534 000023B5 5B                      		pop	bx		; restore old fat entry	value
  7535 000023B6 53                      		push	bx		; save it right	away.
  7536 000023B7 D1EB                    		shr	bx, 1		; was it even or odd?
  7537 000023B9 7308                    		jnb	short havclus	; it was even.
  7538 000023BB D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1		; odd. massage fat value and keep
  7539                                  					; the highest 12 bits.
  7540 000023BD D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1
  7541 000023BF D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1
  7542 000023C1 D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1
  7543                                  havclus:				
  7544 000023C3 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax		; now bx = new fat entry.
  7545 000023C5 81E3FF0F                		and	bx, 0FFFh	; keep low 12 bits.
  7546 000023C9 EB0E                    		jmp	short unpackx
  7547                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7548                                  
  7549                                  unpack16:				
  7550 000023CB 52                      		push	dx
  7551 000023CC 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  7552 000023CE D1E6                    		shl	si, 1		; extend to 32 bit offset
  7553 000023D0 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  7554 000023D3 E83F00                  		call	get_fat_sector
  7555 000023D6 5A                      		pop	dx
  7556 000023D7 8B1F                    		mov	bx, [bx]	;
  7557                                  					; bx = new fat entry.
  7558                                  unpackx:				
  7559 000023D9 5E                      		pop	si		; restore old bx value into si
  7560 000023DA 58                      		pop	ax		; restore logical sector (low)
  7561 000023DB 1F                      		pop	ds
  7562 000023DC 29DE                    		sub	si, bx
  7563 000023DE 83FEFF                  		cmp	si, -1		; one apart?
  7564 000023E1 7507                    		jnz	short getcl2
  7565 000023E3 2E010E[D016]            		add	[cs:doscnt], cx
  7566 000023E8 EB91                    		jmp	short unpack
  7567                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7568                                  
  7569                                  getcl2:					
  7570 000023EA 53                      		push	bx
  7571 000023EB 52                      		push	dx		; sector to read (high)
  7572 000023EC 50                      		push	ax		; sector to read (low)
  7573 000023ED 2EA1[CA16]              		mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]	; get drive and	fat spec
  7574 000023F1 2E8B0E[D016]            		mov	cx, [cs:doscnt]
  7575 000023F6 5A                      		pop	dx		; sector to read for diskrd (low)
  7576 000023F7 2E8F06[2B05]            		pop	word [cs:start_sec_h]
  7577                                  					; sector to read for diskrd (high)
  7578 000023FC 1E                      		push	ds
  7579 000023FD 0E                      		push	cs
  7580 000023FE 1F                      		pop	ds
  7581 000023FF 0E                      		push	cs		; simulate far call
  7582                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7583 00002400 BD[C408]                		mov	bp, DISKRD	; 8E5h
  7584                                  		;mov	bp, 8E5h	; offset diskrd
  7585                                  					; 2C7h:8E5h = 70h:2E55h
  7586 00002403 E85FF3                  		call	call_bios_code	; read the clusters
  7587 00002406 1F                      		pop	ds
  7588 00002407 5B                      		pop	bx
  7589 00002408 5F                      		pop	di
  7590 00002409 2EA1[D016]              		mov	ax, [cs:doscnt]	; get number of	sectors	read
  7591 0000240D 86E0                    		xchg	ah, al		; multiply by 256
  7592 0000240F D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; times	2 equal	512
  7593 00002411 01C7                    		add	di, ax		; update load location
  7594 00002413 59                      		pop	cx		; restore sectors/cluster
  7595 00002414 C3                      		retn
  7596                                  
  7597                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7598                                  
  7599                                  
  7600                                  ;function: find and read the corresponding fat sector into ds:0
  7601                                  ;
  7602                                  ;in). dx:si - offset value (starting from fat entry 0) of fat entry to find. M054
  7603                                  ;     ds - fatloc segment
  7604                                  ;     cs:drvfat - logical drive number, fat id
  7605                                  ;     cs:md_sectorsize
  7606                                  ;     cs:last_fat_secnum - last fat sector number read in.
  7607                                  ;
  7608                                  ;out). corresponding fat sector read in.
  7609                                  ;      bx = offset value from fatlog segment.
  7610                                  ;      other registera saved.
  7611                                  ;      zero flag set if the fat entry is splitted, i.e., when 12 bit fat entry
  7612                                  ;      starts at the last byte of the fat sector. in this case, the caller
  7613                                  ;      should save this byte, and read the next fat sector to get the rest
  7614                                  ;      of the fat entry value. (this will only happen with the 12 bit fat.)
  7615                                  
  7616                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7617                                  get_fat_sector:	
  7618 00002415 50                      		push	ax
  7619 00002416 51                      		push	cx
  7620 00002417 57                      		push	di
  7621 00002418 56                      		push	si
  7622 00002419 06                      		push	es
  7623 0000241A 1E                      		push	ds
  7624 0000241B 89F0                    		mov	ax, si
  7625 0000241D 2E8B0E[D816]            		mov	cx, [cs:md_sectorsize] ; 512
  7626 00002422 F7F1                    		div	cx		; ax = sector number, dx = offset
  7627 00002424 90                      		nop
  7628                                  
  7629                                  		; Get rid of the assumption that
  7630                                  		; there	is only	one reserved sector
  7631                                  
  7632 00002425 06                      		push	es
  7633 00002426 1E                      		push	ds
  7634 00002427 57                      		push	di
  7635 00002428 50                      		push	ax
  7636 00002429 0E                      		push	cs
  7637 0000242A 1F                      		pop	ds
  7638                                  
  7639 0000242B 2EA1[CA16]              		mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]	; get drive # and FAT id
  7640 0000242F BD[CB04]                		mov	bp, SETDRIVE
  7641                                  		;mov	bp, 4D7h	; setdrive
  7642                                  					; at 2C7h:4D7h = 70h:2A47h
  7643 00002432 0E                      		push	cs		; simulate far call
  7644 00002433 E82FF3                  		call	call_bios_code	; get bds for drive
  7645 00002436 58                      		pop	ax		; (sector number -without reserved and hidden sectors-)
  7646 00002437 26034509                		add	ax, [es:di+9]	; [es:di+BDS.resectors]
  7647                                  					; add #reserved_sectors
  7648 0000243B 5F                      		pop	di
  7649 0000243C 1F                      		pop	ds
  7650 0000243D 07                      		pop	es
  7651 0000243E 2E3B06[DC16]            		cmp	ax, [cs:last_fat_sec_num]
  7652 00002443 742A                    		jz	short gfs_split_chk ; don't need to read it again.
  7653 00002445 2EA3[DC16]              		mov	[cs:last_fat_sec_num], ax 
  7654                                  					; sector number
  7655                                  					; (in the partition, without hidden sectors)
  7656 00002449 52                      		push	dx
  7657 0000244A 2EC706[2B05]0000        		mov	word [cs:start_sec_h], 0 
  7658                                  					; prepare to read the fat sector
  7659                                  					; start_sec_h is always	0 for fat sector.
  7660 00002451 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax
  7661 00002453 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; 1 sector read
  7662 00002456 2EA1[CA16]              		mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]
  7663 0000245A 1E                      		push	ds
  7664 0000245B 07                      		pop	es
  7665 0000245C 31FF                    		xor	di, di		; es:di	-> fatloc segment:0
  7666 0000245E 1E                      		push	ds
  7667 0000245F 0E                      		push	cs
  7668 00002460 1F                      		pop	ds
  7669 00002461 0E                      		push	cs		; simulate far call
  7670 00002462 BD[C408]                		mov	bp, DISKRD	; 8E5h
  7671                                  		;mov	bp, 8E5h	; offset diskrd
  7672                                  					; 2C7h:8E5h = 70h:2E55h
  7673 00002465 E8FDF2                  		call	call_bios_code
  7674 00002468 1F                      		pop	ds
  7675 00002469 5A                      		pop	dx
  7676 0000246A 2E8B0E[D816]            		mov	cx, [cs:md_sectorsize] ; 512
  7677                                  
  7678                                  gfs_split_chk:				
  7679 0000246F 49                      		dec	cx		; 511
  7680 00002470 39CA                    		cmp	dx, cx		; if offset points to the
  7681                                  					; last byte of this sector,
  7682                                  					; then splitted	entry.
  7683 00002472 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; set bx to dx
  7684 00002474 1F                      		pop	ds
  7685 00002475 07                      		pop	es
  7686 00002476 5E                      		pop	si
  7687 00002477 5F                      		pop	di
  7688 00002478 59                      		pop	cx
  7689 00002479 58                      		pop	ax
  7690 0000247A C3                      		retn
  7691                                  
  7692                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7693                                  ;Bios_Data_Init	ends
  7694                                  
  7695                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7696                                  
  7697                                  		; 09/12/2022
  7698                                  		;db 0
  7699                                  
  7700                                  numbertodiv	equ ($-BData_start)
  7701                                  numbertomod	equ (numbertodiv % 16)
  7702                                  
  7703                                  %if numbertomod>0 & numbertomod<16
  7704 0000247B 00<rep 5h>              		times (16-numbertomod) db 0
  7705                                  %endif
  7706                                  
  7707                                  ;align 16
  7708                                  
  7709                                  ; 09/12/2022
  7710                                  IOSYSCODESEGOFF	equ $ - BData_start
  7711                                  IOSYSCODESEG	equ (IOSYSCODESEGOFF>>4)+(700h>>4)
  7712                                  
  7713                                  ;--- End of DOSBIOS data segment --------------------------------------------
  7714                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7715                                  		;db 4 dup(0)
  7716                                  ; 09/12/2022		
  7717                                  ;		times 4 db 0	; 19/10/2022
  7718                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7719                                  
  7720                                  ;============================================================================
  7721                                  ; DOS BIOS (IO.SYS) CODE SEGMENT 
  7722                                  ;============================================================================
  7723                                  ; 09/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7724                                  
  7725                                  section .BIOSCODE vstart=0  
  7726                                  
  7727                                  BCode_start:	 ; 09/12/2022
  7728                                   
  7729                                  ; 02/10/2022
  7730                                  
  7731                                  ;--- DOSBIOS code segment ---------------------------------------------------
  7732                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7733                                  ; MSBIO1.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  7734                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7735                                  
  7736                                  DOSBIOSEG_2C7h:	;db 30h dup(0)		; SEGMENT 2C7h (2C70h-700h=2570h)
  7737 00000000 00<rep 30h>             		times 48 db 0		; 19/10/2022	
  7738 00000030 7000                    BiosDataWord:	dw 70h
  7739                                  
  7740                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7741                                  ;BIOSDATAWORD	equ BiosDataWord - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h
  7742                                  ; 09/12/2022
  7743                                  BIOSDATAWORD	equ BiosDataWord
  7744                                  
  7745                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7746                                  
  7747                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS) 
  7748                                  
  7749                                  ;************************************************************************
  7750                                  ;*									*
  7751                                  ;*	seg_reinit is called with ax = our new code segment value,	*
  7752                                  ;*	  trashes di, cx, es						*
  7753                                  ;*									*
  7754                                  ;*	cas -- should be made disposable!				*
  7755                                  ;*									*
  7756                                  ;************************************************************************
  7757                                  
  7758                                  _seg_reinit:
  7759 00000032 2E8E06[3000]            		mov	es, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
  7760                                  					; at 2C7h:30h or 70h:25A0h
  7761                                  		;mov	di, (offset cdev+2)
  7762 00000037 BF[E006]                		mov	di, cdev+2	; 19/10/2022
  7763 0000003A B90400                  		mov	cx, 4		; (end_BC_entries - cdev)/4
  7764                                  
  7765                                  _seg_reinit_1:				
  7766 0000003D AB                      		stosw			; modify Bios_Code entry points
  7767 0000003E 47                      		inc	di
  7768 0000003F 47                      		inc	di
  7769 00000040 E2FB                    		loop	_seg_reinit_1
  7770 00000042 CB                      		retf
  7771                                  
  7772                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7773                                  
  7774                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7775                                  
  7776                                  ;************************************************************************
  7777                                  ;*									*
  7778                                  ;*	chardev_entry - main device driver dispatch routine		*
  7779                                  ;*	   called with a dummy parameter block on the stack		*
  7780                                  ;*	   dw dispatch_table, dw prn/aux numbers (optional)		*
  7781                                  ;*									*
  7782                                  ;*	will eventually take care of doing the transitions in		*
  7783                                  ;*	   out of Bios_Code						*
  7784                                  ;*									*
  7785                                  ;************************************************************************
  7786                                  
  7787                                  chardev_entry:				; 0070h:25B3h =	02C7h:0043h
  7788 00000043 56                      		push	si
  7789 00000044 50                      		push	ax
  7790 00000045 51                      		push	cx
  7791 00000046 52                      		push	dx
  7792 00000047 57                      		push	di
  7793 00000048 55                      		push	bp
  7794 00000049 1E                      		push	ds
  7795 0000004A 06                      		push	es
  7796 0000004B 53                      		push	bx
  7797 0000004C 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
  7798 0000004E 8B7612                  		mov	si, [bp+18]	; get return address (dispatch table)
  7799                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
  7800                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
  7801 00000051 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
  7802 00000056 8B4402                  		mov	ax, [si+2]	; get the device number	if present
  7803 00000059 A2[2100]                		mov	[auxnum], al
  7804 0000005C 8826[E704]              		mov	[printdev], ah
  7805 00000060 8B34                    		mov	si, [si]	; point	to the device dispatch table
  7806 00000062 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; get pointer to i/o packet
  7807 00000066 268A4701                		mov	al, [es:bx+1]	; [es:bx+unit]	; al = unit code
  7808 0000006A 268A670D                		mov	ah, [es:bx+13]	; [es:bx+media]	; ah = media descrip
  7809 0000006E 268B4F12                		mov	cx, [es:bx+18]	; [es:bx+count]	; cx = count
  7810 00000072 268B5714                		mov	dx, [es:bx+20]	; [es:bx+start]	; dx = start sector
  7811                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7812 00000076 81FE[9604]              		cmp	si, DSKTBL
  7813                                  		;cmp	si, 4A2h	; dsktbl
  7814                                  					; at 2C7h:4A2h = 70h:2A12h
  7815 0000007A 7517                    		jnz	short no_sector32_mapping
  7816                                  
  7817                                  ; Special case for 32-bit start sector number:
  7818                                  ;   if (si==dsktbl) /* if this is a disk device call */
  7819                                  ;      set high 16 bits of secnum to 0
  7820                                  ;      if (secnum == 0xffff) fetch 32 bit sector number
  7821                                  ;
  7822                                  ; pass high word of sector number in start_sec_h, low word in dx
  7823                                  ;
  7824                                  ; note: start_l and start_h are the offsets within the io_request packet
  7825                                  ;	  which contain the low and hi words of the 32 bit start sector if
  7826                                  ;	  it has been used.
  7827                                  ;
  7828                                  ; note: remember not to destroy the registers which have been set up before
  7829                                  
  7830                                  		;mov	ds:start_sec_h,	0 ; initialize to 0
  7831 0000007C C706[2B05]0000          		mov	word [start_sec_h], 0
  7832 00000082 83FAFF                  		cmp	dx, 0FFFFh
  7833 00000085 750C                    		jnz	short no_sector32_mapping
  7834 00000087 268B571C                		mov	dx, [es:bx+28]	; [es:bx+start_h]
  7835                                  					; 32 bits dsk req
  7836                                  		;mov	ds:start_sec_h,	dx ; start_sec_h = packet.start_h
  7837 0000008B 8916[2B05]              		mov	[start_sec_h], dx
  7838 0000008F 268B571A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+26]	; [es:bx+start_l]
  7839                                  					; dx = packet.start_l
  7840                                  no_sector32_mapping:			
  7841 00000093 97                      		xchg	ax, di
  7842 00000094 268A4702                		mov	al, [es:bx+2]	; [es:bx+cmd]
  7843 00000098 2E3A04                  		cmp	al, cs:[si]
  7844 0000009B 732C                    		jnb	short command_error
  7845 0000009D 98                      		cbw			; note that al <= 15 means ok
  7846 0000009E D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  7847 000000A0 01C6                    		add	si, ax
  7848 000000A2 97                      		xchg	ax, di
  7849 000000A3 26C47F0E                		les	di, [es:bx+14]	; [es:bx+trans]
  7850 000000A7 FC                      		cld
  7851                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7852 000000A8 2EFF5401                		call	near [cs:si+1]
  7853                                  		;call	word ptr cs:si+1
  7854 000000AC 7202                    		jb	short already_got_ah_status
  7855 000000AE B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  7856                                  already_got_ah_status:
  7857                                  		;;mov	ds, [cs:0030h]	; 15/10/2022			
  7858                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
  7859                                  					; cas note: shouldn't be needed!
  7860 000000B0 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
  7861                                  		;lds	bx, ds:ptrsav
  7862 000000B5 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]
  7863 000000B9 894703                  		mov	[bx+3],	ax	; [bx+status]
  7864                                  					; mark operation complete
  7865 000000BC 5B                      		pop	bx
  7866 000000BD 07                      		pop	es
  7867 000000BE 1F                      		pop	ds
  7868 000000BF 5D                      		pop	bp
  7869 000000C0 5F                      		pop	di
  7870 000000C1 5A                      		pop	dx
  7871 000000C2 59                      		pop	cx
  7872 000000C3 58                      		pop	ax
  7873 000000C4 5E                      		pop	si
  7874 000000C5 83C402                  		add	sp, 2		; get rid of fake return address
  7875                                  	
  7876                                  		; fall through into bc_retf
  7877                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------	
  7878                                  bc_retf:
  7879 000000C8 CB                      		retf
  7880                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7881                                  
  7882                                  command_error:				
  7883 000000C9 E80900                  		call	bc_cmderr
  7884 000000CC EBE2                    		jmp	short already_got_ah_status
  7885                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7886                                  ; 01/05/2019
  7887                                  
  7888                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7889                                  ; The following piece of hack is for supporting CP/M compatibility
  7890                                  ; Basically at offset 5 we have a far call into 0:c0. But this does not call
  7891                                  ; 0:c0 directly instead it call f01d:fef0, because it needs to support 'lhld 6'
  7892                                  ; The following hack has to reside at ffff:d0 (= f01d:fef0) if BIOS is loaded
  7893                                  ; high.
  7894                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7895                                  
  7896                                  		;db 7 dup(0)
  7897                                  
  7898                                  		; 15/10/2022
  7899                                  
  7900 000000CE 0000                    		dw 0		; pad to bring offset to 0D0h
  7901                                  
  7902 000000D0 00<rep 5h>              off_d0: 	times 5 db 0	; 5 bytes from 0:c0 will be copied onto here
  7903                                  				;  which is the CP/M call 5 entry point
  7904                                  		
  7905                                  
  7906                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7907                                  
  7908                                  ;	exit - all routines return through this path
  7909                                  
  7910                                  bc_cmderr:				
  7911 000000D5 B003                    		mov	al, 3		; 2C7h:D5h = 70h:2645h
  7912                                  					; unknown command error
  7913                                  
  7914                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7915                                  
  7916                                  ;	now zero the count field by subtracting its current value,
  7917                                  ;	  which is still in cx, from itself.
  7918                                  
  7919                                  ;	subtract the number of i/o's NOT YET COMPLETED from total
  7920                                  ;	  in order to return the number actually complete
  7921                                  
  7922                                  bc_err_cnt:	
  7923                                  		;les	bx, ds:ptrsav
  7924                                  		; 19/10/2022
  7925 000000D7 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
  7926 000000DB 26294F12                		sub	[es:bx+18], cx	; [es:bx+count]
  7927                                  					; # of successful i/o's
  7928 000000DF B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; mark error return
  7929 000000E1 F9                      		stc			; indicate abnormal end
  7930 000000E2 C3                      		retn
  7931                                  
  7932                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7933                                  
  7934                                  ;Bios_Code ends
  7935                                  
  7936                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7937                                  ; MSCHAR.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
  7938                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7939                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7940                                  ; 10/01/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7941                                  
  7942                                  ; 30/04/2019
  7943                                  
  7944                                  ;title	mschar - character and clock devices
  7945                                  
  7946                                  ;MODE_CTRLBRK	equ	0FFh
  7947                                  
  7948                                  ; BIOSCODE:00E4h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  7949                                  
  7950                                  ;************************************************************************
  7951                                  ;*									*
  7952                                  ;*	device driver dispatch tables					*
  7953                                  ;*									*
  7954                                  ;*	each table starts with a byte which lists the number of		*
  7955                                  ;*	legal functions, followed by that number of words. Each		*
  7956                                  ;*	word represents an offset of a routine in Bios_Code which	*
  7957                                  ;*	handles the function. The functions are terminated with		*
  7958                                  ;*	a near return. If carry is reset, a 'done' code is returned	*
  7959                                  ;*	to the caller. If carry is set, the ah/al registers are		*
  7960                                  ;*	returned as abnormal completion status. Notice that ds		*
  7961                                  ;*	is assumed to point to the Bios_Data segment throughout.	*
  7962                                  ;*									*
  7963                                  ;************************************************************************
  7964                                  
  7965                                  		; 13/12/2022
  7966                                  		;db 0
  7967                                  
  7968                                  		; 13/12/202
  7969 000000E3 0B                      con_table:	db ((con_table_end - con_table)-1)/2 ; 11
  7970                                  					; 2C7h:0E4h = 70h:2654h
  7971 000000E4 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec  ; 1FBh	; bc_exvec at 2C7h:1FBh	= 70h:276Bh
  7972                                  					; 00 init
  7973 000000E6 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec  ; 1FBh	; 01
  7974 000000E8 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec  ; 1FBh	; 02
  7975 000000EA [D500]                  		dw bc_cmderr ; 0D5h	; bc_exvec at 2C7h:D5h = 70h:2645h
  7976                                  					; 03
  7977 000000EC [5B01]                  		dw con_read  ; 15Ch	; con_read at 2C7h:15Ch	= 70h:26CCh
  7978                                  					; 04
  7979 000000EE [9E01]                  		dw con_rdnd  ; 19Fh	; con_rdnd at 2C7h:19Fh	= 70h:270Fh
  7980                                  					; 05
  7981 000000F0 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec  ; 1FBh	; 06
  7982 000000F2 [0702]                  		dw con_flush ; 209h	; con_flush at 2C7h:209h = 70h:2779h
  7983                                  					; 07
  7984 000000F4 [FB01]                  		dw con_writ  ; 1FDh	; con_writ at 2C7h:1FDh	= 70h:276Dh
  7985                                  					; 08
  7986 000000F6 [FB01]                  		dw con_writ  ; 1FDh	; 09
  7987 000000F8 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec  ; 1FBh	; 0A
  7988                                  con_table_end:
  7989 000000FA 1A                      prn_table:	db ((prn_table_end - prn_table)-1)/2 ; 26			
  7990                                  					; 2C7h:0FBh = 70h:266Bh
  7991 000000FB [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; bc_exvec
  7992 000000FD [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 01
  7993 000000FF [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 02
  7994 00000101 [D500]                  		dw bc_cmderr  ;	0D5h	; bc_cmderr
  7995 00000103 [1802]                  		dw prn_input  ;	21Ah	; prn_input
  7996                                  					; 04 indicate zero chars read
  7997 00000105 [C601]                  		dw z_bus_exit ; 1C8h	; z_bus_exit
  7998                                  					; 05 read non-destructive
  7999 00000107 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 06
  8000 00000109 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 07
  8001 0000010B [1D02]                  		dw prn_writ   ;	21Fh	; prn_writ
  8002 0000010D [1D02]                  		dw prn_writ   ; 21Fh	; 09
  8003 0000010F [4E02]                  		dw prn_stat   ; 251h	; prn_stat
  8004 00000111 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 0B
  8005 00000113 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 0C
  8006 00000115 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 0D
  8007 00000117 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 0E
  8008 00000119 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 0F
  8009 0000011B [8802]                  		dw prn_tilbusy ; 28Bh	; prn_tilbusy
  8010 0000011D [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 11
  8011 0000011F [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 12
  8012 00000121 [B602]                  		dw prn_genioctl ; 2BAh	; prn_genioctl
  8013 00000123 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 14
  8014 00000125 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 15
  8015 00000127 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 16
  8016 00000129 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 17
  8017 0000012B [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 18
  8018 0000012D [EB02]                  		dw prn_ioctl_query ; 2F0h ; prn_ioctl_query
  8019                                  prn_table_end:
  8020 0000012F 0B                      aux_table:	db ((aux_table_end - aux_table)-1)/2 ; 11			
  8021                                  					; 2C7h:130h = 70h:26A0h
  8022 00000130 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 00 - init
  8023 00000132 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 01
  8024 00000134 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 02
  8025 00000136 [D500]                  		dw bc_cmderr  ;	0D5h	; 03
  8026 00000138 [0603]                  		dw aux_read   ; 30Dh	; aux_read ; 04	- read
  8027 0000013A [2D03]                  		dw aux_rdnd   ; 335h	; aux_rdnd - 05	- read non-destructive
  8028 0000013C [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 06
  8029 0000013E [6303]                  		dw aux_flsh   ;	36Ch	; aux_flsh
  8030 00000140 [6A03]                  		dw aux_writ   ;	374h	; aux_writ
  8031 00000142 [6A03]                  		dw aux_writ   ;	374h	; 09
  8032 00000144 [4D03]                  		dw aux_wrst   ;	355h	; aux_wrst
  8033                                  aux_table_end:
  8034 00000146 0A                      tim_table	db ((tim_table_end - tim_table)-1)/2 ; 10
  8035                                  					; 2C7h:147h = 70h:26B7h
  8036 00000147 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 00
  8037 00000149 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 01
  8038 0000014B [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 02
  8039 0000014D [D500]                  		dw bc_cmderr  ;	0D5h	; 03
  8040 0000014F [2904]                  		dw tim_read   ;	435h	; tim_read
  8041 00000151 [C601]                  		dw z_bus_exit ; 1C8h	; z_bus_exit
  8042 00000153 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 06
  8043 00000155 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 07
  8044 00000157 [D003]                  		dw tim_writ   ; 3DBh	; tim_writ
  8045 00000159 [D003]                  		dw tim_writ   ; 3DBh	; 09
  8046                                  tim_table_end:
  8047                                  
  8048                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8049                                  
  8050                                  ;************************************************************************
  8051                                  ;*									*
  8052                                  ;*	con_read - read cx bytes from keyboard into buffer at es:di	*
  8053                                  ;*									*
  8054                                  ;************************************************************************
  8055                                  
  8056                                  con_read:				; 2C7h:15Ch = 70h:26CCh
  8057                                  		;jcxz	short con_exit	; read cx bytes	from keyboard into buffer
  8058 0000015B E306                    		jcxz	con_exit	; 19/10/2022
  8059                                  con_loop:				
  8060 0000015D E80500                  		call	chrin		; get char in al
  8061 00000160 AA                      		stosb			; store	char at	es:di
  8062 00000161 E2FA                    		loop	con_loop
  8063                                  con_exit:				
  8064 00000163 F8                      		clc
  8065 00000164 C3                      		retn
  8066                                  
  8067                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8068                                  
  8069                                  ;************************************************************************
  8070                                  ;*									*
  8071                                  ;*	chrin - input single char from keyboard into al			*
  8072                                  ;*									*
  8073                                  ;*	  we are going to issue extended keyboard function, if		*
  8074                                  ;*	  supported. the returning value of the extended keystroke	*
  8075                                  ;*	  of the extended keyboard function uses 0E0h in al		*
  8076                                  ;*	  instead of 00h as in the conventional keyboard function.	*
  8077                                  ;*	  this creates a conflict when the user entered real		*
  8078                                  ;*	  greek alpha charater (= 0E0h) to  distinguish the extended	*
  8079                                  ;*	  keystroke and the greek alpha. this case will be handled	*
  8080                                  ;*	  in the following manner:					*
  8081                                  ;*									*
  8082                                  ;*	      ah = 16h							*
  8083                                  ;*	      int 16h							*
  8084                                  ;*	      if al == 0, then extended code (in ah)			*
  8085                                  ;*	      else if al == 0E0h, then					*
  8086                                  ;*	      if ah <> 0, then extended code (in ah)			*
  8087                                  ;*		else greek_alpha character.				*
  8088                                  ;*									*
  8089                                  ;*	also, for compatibility reason, if an extended code is		*
  8090                                  ;*	  detected, then we are going to change the value in al		*
  8091                                  ;*	  from 0E0h to 00h.						*
  8092                                  ;*									*
  8093                                  ;************************************************************************
  8094                                  
  8095                                  		; 19/10/2022
  8096                                  chrin:		
  8097 00000165 8A26[E504]              		mov	ah, [keyrd_func] ; set by msinit. 0 or 10h
  8098 00000169 30C0                    		xor	al, al
  8099 0000016B 8606[0C00]              		xchg	al, [altah]	; get character	& zero altah
  8100 0000016F 08C0                    		or	al, al
  8101 00000171 752A                    		jnz	short keyret
  8102 00000173 CD16                    		int	16h		; KEYBOARD -
  8103 00000175 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
  8104 00000177 74EC                    		jz	short chrin
  8105 00000179 3D0072                  		cmp	ax, 7200h	; check	for ctrl-prtsc
  8106 0000017C 7504                    		jnz	short alt_ext_chk
  8107 0000017E B010                    		mov	al, 10h
  8108 00000180 EB1B                    		jmp	short keyret
  8109                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8110                                  
  8111                                  ;  if operation was extended function (i.e. keyrd_func != 0) then
  8112                                  ;    if character read was 0E0h then
  8113                                  ;      if extended byte was zero (i.e. ah == 0) then
  8114                                  ;	 goto keyret
  8115                                  ;      else
  8116                                  ;	 set al to zero
  8117                                  ;	 goto alt_save
  8118                                  ;      endif
  8119                                  ;    endif
  8120                                  ;  endif
  8121                                  
  8122                                  alt_ext_chk:
  8123 00000182 803E[E504]00            		cmp	byte [keyrd_func], 0
  8124 00000187 740C                    		jz	short not_ext
  8125 00000189 3CE0                    		cmp	al, 0E0h
  8126 0000018B 7508                    		jnz	short not_ext
  8127 0000018D 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
  8128 0000018F 740C                    		jz	short keyret
  8129 00000191 30C0                    		xor	al, al
  8130 00000193 EB04                    		jmp	short alt_save
  8131                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8132                                  
  8133                                  not_ext:				
  8134 00000195 08C0                    		or	al, al		; special case?
  8135 00000197 7504                    		jnz	short keyret
  8136                                  alt_save:				
  8137 00000199 8826[0C00]              		mov	[altah], ah	; store	special	key
  8138                                  keyret:					
  8139 0000019D C3                      		retn
  8140                                  
  8141                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8142                                  
  8143                                  ;************************************************************************
  8144                                  ;*									*
  8145                                  ;*	con_rdnd - keyboard non destructive read, no wait		*
  8146                                  ;*									*
  8147                                  ;*	pc-convertible-type machine: if bit 10 is set by the dos	*
  8148                                  ;*	in the status word of the request packet, and there is no	*
  8149                                  ;*	character in the input buffer, the driver issues a system	*
  8150                                  ;*	wait request to the rom. on return from the rom, it returns	*
  8151                                  ;*	a 'char-not-found' to the dos.					*
  8152                                  ;*									*
  8153                                  ;************************************************************************
  8154                                  
  8155                                  		; 19/10/2022
  8156                                  con_rdnd:				
  8157 0000019E A0[0C00]                		mov	al, [altah]
  8158 000001A1 08C0                    		or	al, al
  8159 000001A3 754C                    		jnz	short rdexit
  8160 000001A5 8A26[E604]              		mov	ah, [keysts_func]
  8161 000001A9 CD16                    		int	16h		; KEYBOARD -
  8162 000001AB 751D                    		jnz	short gotchr
  8163 000001AD 803E[7900]00            		cmp	byte [fhavek09], 0
  8164 000001B2 7412                    		jz	short z_bus_exit
  8165 000001B4 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
  8166                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8167 000001B8 26F6470404              		test	byte [es:bx+4], 04h
  8168                                  		;test	word [es:bx+3], 400h ; [es:bx+status]
  8169 000001BD 7407                    		jz	short z_bus_exit
  8170 000001BF B80041                  		mov	ax, 4100h
  8171 000001C2 30DB                    		xor	bl, bl
  8172 000001C4 CD15                    		int	15h		; SYSTEM - WAIT	ON EXTERNAL EVENT (CONVERTIBLE)
  8173                                  					; AL = condition type, BH = condition compare or mask value
  8174                                  					; BL = timeout value times 55 milliseconds, 00h	means no timeout
  8175                                  					; DX = I/O port	address	if AL bit 4 set
  8176                                  z_bus_exit:				
  8177 000001C6 F9                      		stc			; 2C7h:1C8h = 70h:2738h
  8178 000001C7 B403                    		mov	ah, 3		; indicate busy	status
  8179 000001C9 C3                      		retn
  8180                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8181                                  
  8182                                  gotchr:					
  8183 000001CA 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
  8184 000001CC 7508                    		jnz	short notbrk	; check	for null after break
  8185 000001CE 8A26[E504]              		mov	ah, [keyrd_func] ; issue keyboard read function
  8186 000001D2 CD16                    		int	16h		; KEYBOARD -
  8187 000001D4 EBC8                    		jmp	short con_rdnd	; get a	real status
  8188                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8189                                  
  8190                                  notbrk:					
  8191 000001D6 3D0072                  		cmp	ax, 7200h	; check	for ctrl-prtsc
  8192 000001D9 7504                    		jnz	short rd_ext_chk
  8193 000001DB B010                    		mov	al, 10h		; ('P' & 1Fh) ; return control p
  8194 000001DD EB12                    		jmp	short rdexit
  8195                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8196                                  
  8197                                  rd_ext_chk:				
  8198 000001DF 803E[E504]00            		cmp	byte [keyrd_func], 0 ; extended keyboard function?
  8199 000001E4 740B                    		jz	short rdexit
  8200 000001E6 3CE0                    		cmp	al, 0E0h	; extended key value or	greek alpha?
  8201 000001E8 7507                    		jnz	short rdexit
  8202 000001EA 80FC00                  		cmp	ah, 0		; scan code exist?
  8203 000001ED 7402                    		jz	short rdexit	; yes. greek alpha char.
  8204 000001EF B000                    		mov	al, 0		; no. extended key stroke.
  8205                                  					; change it for	compatibility
  8206                                  rdexit:					
  8207 000001F1 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
  8208 000001F5 2688470D                		mov	[es:bx+13], al	; [es:bx+media]
  8209                                  					; return keyboard character here
  8210                                  bc_exvec:				
  8211 000001F9 F8                      		clc			; bc_exvec at 2C7h:1FBh	= 70h:276Bh
  8212                                  					; indicate normal termination
  8213 000001FA C3                      		retn
  8214                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8215                                  
  8216                                  ;************************************************************************
  8217                                  ;*									*
  8218                                  ;*	con_write - console write routine				*
  8219                                  ;*									*
  8220                                  ;*	entry:	es:di -> buffer						*
  8221                                  ;*		cx    =  count						*
  8222                                  ;*									*
  8223                                  ;************************************************************************
  8224                                  
  8225                                  con_writ:
  8226                                  		;jcxz	short bc_exvec
  8227 000001FB E3FC                    		jcxz	bc_exvec	; 19/10/2022

  8232 00000200 47                      		inc	di

  8234                                  					; AL = character to display

  8237 00000205 F8                      		clc

  8239                                  
  8240                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================

  8242                                  ;************************************************************************
  8243                                  ;*									*
  8244                                  ;*	con_flush - flush out keyboard queue				*
  8245                                  ;*									*

  8247

  8249 00000207 C606[0C00]00            		mov	byte [altah], 0	; clear	out holding buffer
  8250                                  flloop:					; while	(charavail()) charread();	
  8251 0000020C B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  8252 0000020E CD16                    		int	16h		; KEYBOARD - CHECK BUFFER, DO NOT CLEAR
  8253                                  					; Return: ZF clear if character	in buffer
  8254                                  					; AH = scan code, AL = character
  8255                                  					; ZF set if no character in buffer
  8256 00000210 74F3                    		jz	short cc_ret
  8257 00000212 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  8258 00000214 CD16                    		int	16h		; KEYBOARD - READ CHAR FROM BUFFER, WAIT IF EMPTY
  8259                                  					; Return: AH = scan code, AL = character
  8260 00000216 EBF4                    		jmp	short flloop
  8261

  8264                                  ; 15/10/2022
