 13022 0000138B EBE5                    		jmp	short ii2f_iret
 13023                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13024                                  
 13025                                  try_2:					
 13026 0000138D 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; multMULTALLOCHMA
 13027 0000138F 7530                    		jnz	short try_3
 13028 00001391 1E                      		push	ds
 13029                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13030                                  		;xor	di, di
 13031                                  		;dec	di
 13032 00001392 BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh	; assume not enough space
 13033 00001395 8EC7                    		mov	es, di
 13034 00001397 E82900                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 13035 0000139A 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13036 0000139D 7421                    		jz	short InsuffHMA
 13037 0000139F F7DF                    		neg	di		; free space in HMA
 13038 000013A1 39FB                    		cmp	bx, di
 13039 000013A3 7605                    		jbe	short try_4
 13040                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13041                                  		;sub	di, di
 13042                                  		;dec	di
 13043 000013A5 BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh
 13044 000013A8 EB16                    		jmp	short InsuffHMA
 13045                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13046                                  
 13047                                  try_4:					
 13048                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13049 000013AA 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13050 000013AE 83C30F                  		add	bx, 15
 13051                                  		;and	bx, 0FFF0h
 13052                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13053 000013B1 80E3F0                  		and	bl, 0F0h
 13054                                  		;add	ds:FreeHMAPtr, bx ; update the free pointer	
 13055 000013B4 011E[F508]              		add	[FreeHMAPtr], bx
 13056 000013B8 7506                    		jnz	short InsuffHMA
 13057 000013BA C706[F508]FFFF          		mov	word [FreeHMAPtr], 0FFFFh ; -1
 13058                                  		;mov	ds:FreeHMAPtr, 0FFFFh
 13059                                  					; no more HMA if we have wrapped
 13060                                  InsuffHMA:				
 13061 000013C0 1F                      		pop	ds
 13062                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13063                                  try_3:		
 13064 000013C1 EBAF                    		jmp	short ii2f_iret
 13065                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13066                                  
 13067                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13068                                  ;try_3:					
 13069                                  		;jmp	ii2f_iret
 13070                                  
 13071                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13072                                  
 13073                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13074                                  
 13075                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13076                                  ;
 13077                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13078                                  ;
 13079                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13080                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13081                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13082                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13083                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13084                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13085                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13086                                  ;
 13087                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13088                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13089                                  ;
 13090                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13091                                  
 13092                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13093                                  HMAPtr:
 13094 000013C3 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13095                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13096 000013C8 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13097                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13098 000013CC 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13099 000013CF 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13100 000013D1 803E[FB08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13101                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13102 000013D6 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13103 000013D8 FF1E[F708]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13104                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13105 000013DC 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13106                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13107                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13108 000013E0 C3                      		retn
 13109                                  
 13110                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13111                                  
 13112                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13113                                  
 13114                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13115                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13116                                  
 13117                                  move_sector:
 13118                                  
 13119                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13120                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13121                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13122                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13123                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13124                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13125                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13126                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13127                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13128                                  ;
 13129                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13130                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13131                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13132                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13133                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13134                                  
 13135 000013E1 FC                      		cld
 13136 000013E2 51                      		push	cx
 13137 000013E3 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13138 000013E6 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13139 000013EA 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13140 000013EC 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13141 000013F0 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13142 000013F2 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13143 000013F4 59                      		pop	cx
 13144 000013F5 C3                      		retn
 13145                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13146                                  
 13147                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13148 000013F6 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13149 000013F8 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13150 000013FA 59                      		pop	cx
 13151 000013FB C3                      		retn
 13152                                  
 13153                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13154                                  
 13155                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13156                                  
 13157                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13158                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13159                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13160                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13161                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13162                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13163                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13164                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13165                                  ;
 13166                                  ; input conditions:
 13167                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13168                                  ;
 13169                                  ; output:
 13170                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13171                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13172                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13173                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13174                                  
 13175                                  check_wrap:	
 13176 000013FC 50                      		push	ax
 13177 000013FD 53                      		push	bx
 13178 000013FE 06                      		push	es
 13179 000013FF 57                      		push	di
 13180 00001400 E86E00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13181 00001403 7260                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13182                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13183 00001405 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13184                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13185 0000140A 7459                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13186 0000140C 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13187 00001410 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13188 00001412 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13189 00001415 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13190 00001417 764C                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13191 00001419 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13192                                  
 13193                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13194                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13195                                  
 13196 0000141B 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13197 0000141D 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13198                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13199 0000141F 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13200 00001420 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13201                                  					; if on	boundary
 13202                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13203                                  not_on_bound:				
 13204 00001422 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13205 00001425 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13206 00001427 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13207 00001429 40                      		inc	ax
 13208 0000142A 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13209 0000142C 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13210 0000142F 263B4515                		cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13211                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13212 00001433 7636                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13213 00001435 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13214 00001436 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13215 00001438 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13216 0000143C F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13217                                  
 13218                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13219                                  
 13220 0000143E 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13221 00001440 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13222 00001442 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13223                                  
 13224                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13225                                  
 13226 00001444 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13227 00001446 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13228 00001448 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13229                                  no_head_bound:				
 13230 00001449 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13231 0000144B 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13232 0000144C FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13233 0000144E 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13234 00001450 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13235 00001452 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13236 00001455 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13237 00001457 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13238 00001459 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13239 0000145B 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13240 0000145D 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13241 0000145F D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13242 00001461 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13243 00001463 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13244                                  no_wrap:				
 13245 00001465 F8                      		clc
 13246 00001466 5F                      		pop	di
 13247 00001467 07                      		pop	es
 13248 00001468 5B                      		pop	bx
 13249 00001469 58                      		pop	ax
 13250 0000146A C3                      		retn
 13251                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13252                                  
 13253                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13254 0000146B 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13255 0000146D FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13256 0000146F EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13257                                  
 13258                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13259                                  
 13260                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13261                                  
 13262                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13263                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13264                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13265                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13266                                  ;
 13267                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13268                                  
 13269                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13270                                  find_bds:	
 13271 00001471 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13272                                  fbds_1:					
 13273 00001475 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13274 00001479 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13275 0000147B 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13276                                  					; go to next bds
 13277 0000147E 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13278 00001481 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13279 00001483 F9                      		stc
 13280                                  fdbs_2:					
 13281 00001484 C3                      		retn
 13282                                  
 13283                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13284                                  
 13285                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13286                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13287                                  doint:
 13288                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13289 00001485 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13290                                  					; get physical drive number
 13291                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13292                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13293                                  		
 13294 00001488 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13295 0000148A 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13296 0000148C 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13297                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13298 0000148E 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13299                                  					; get request code
 13300                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13301 00001491 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13302                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13303 00001494 9D                      		popf
 13304                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13305                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13306 00001495 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13307                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13308                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13309 0000149A 9C                      		pushf
 13310                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13311 0000149B 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13312                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13313                                  dointdone:				
 13314 0000149E C3                      		retn
 13315                                  
 13316                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13317                                  
 13318                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13319                                  
 13320                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13321                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13322                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13323                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13324                                  ;
 13325                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13326                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13327                                  ;
 13328                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13329                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13330                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13331                                  
 13332                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13333                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13334                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13335                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13336                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13337                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13338                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13339                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13340                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13341                                  ;end struc
 13342                                  
 13343                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13344                                  
 13345                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13346                                  ;	ah = function
 13347                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13348                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13349                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13350                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13351                                  ;   output conditions:
 13352                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13353                                  
 13354                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13355                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13356                                  ;
 13357                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13358                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13359                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13360                                  
 13361                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13362                                  
 13363                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13364                                  
 13365 0000149F 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13366                                  
 13367                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13368                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13369                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13370                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13371                                  
 13372                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13373                                  
 13374                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13375                                  
 13376                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13377                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13378                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13379                                  
 13380                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13381 000014A3 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13382 000014A8 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13383 000014AA 53                      		push	bx
 13384 000014AB BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13385 000014AE E83804                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13386 000014B1 5B                      		pop	bx
 13387 000014B2 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13388                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13389                                  
 13390                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13391                                  
 13392                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13393                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13394                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 13395                                  
 13396                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13397                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 13398 000014B4 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 13399 000014B6 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 13400 000014B8 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 13401 000014B9 51                      		push	cx
 13402 000014BA 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 13403 000014BC B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 13404 000014BE D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 13405 000014C0 8406[3105]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13406 000014C4 59                      		pop	cx
 13407 000014C5 58                      		pop	ax
 13408 000014C6 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13409                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13410 000014C8 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13411 000014C9 06                      		push	es
 13412                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13413 000014CA 2EC41E[9F14]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13414                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13415                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 13416 000014CF 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 13417 000014D1 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13418 000014D4 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13419                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13420                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13421 000014D8 07                      		pop	es
 13422 000014D9 5B                      		pop	bx
 13423 000014DA EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13424                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13425                                  
 13426                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13427                                  
 13428                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13429                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13430                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13431                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13432                                  
 13433                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13434 000014DC 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13435                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13436 000014E1 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13437 000014E3 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13438                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13439 000014E8 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13440                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13441 000014EA 50                      		push	ax
 13442 000014EB B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13443                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13444                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13445 000014ED 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13446                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13447                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13448 000014F2 58                      		pop	ax
 13449 000014F3 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13450                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13451                                  
 13452                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13453                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13454                                  
 13455                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13456                                  
 13457                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13458                                  
 13459                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13460                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13461                                  
 13462                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13463 000014F5 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 13464                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13465                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 13466 000014F6 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13467                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13468                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13469                                  
 13470                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13471                                  
 13472 000014FB A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 13473 000014FE 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13474 00001501 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 13475                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13476                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13477 00001503 803E[3105]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 13478 00001508 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 13479                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 13480                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 13481                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13482 0000150A 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13483                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13484                                  		
 13485 0000150F 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 13486                                  		
 13487 00001510 803E[3E06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 13488                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 13489 00001515 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 13490                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 13491                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 13492 00001517 9D                      		popf
 13493 00001518 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 13494                                  ret_from_i13:				
 13495 0000151A 1F                      		pop	ds
 13496 0000151B CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 13497                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13498                                  
 13499                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 13500                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 13501                                  ; a changeline error.
 13502                                  
 13503                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 13504 0000151E 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 13505                                  i13_ret_error:				
 13506 00001520 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 13507 00001523 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 13508 00001525 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 13509 00001527 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 13510 00001529 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 13511 0000152E 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 13512                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 13513                                  					; never	would
 13514 00001530 53                      		push	bx
 13515 00001531 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 13516 00001534 E8B203                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13517 00001537 5B                      		pop	bx
 13518                                  int13b:					
 13519 00001538 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 13520 00001539 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 13521                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13522                                  
 13523                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 13524                                  
 13525                                  goterr13:				
 13526 0000153B 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 13527 0000153E 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 13528                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 13529 00001540 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 13530 00001543 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 13531 00001545 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 13532 0000154A 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 13533                                  
 13534 0000154C 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 13535                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 13536                                  					; (2 = romread)
 13537                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 13538 00001551 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 13539                                  
 13540 00001553 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13541                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 13542                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13543 00001555 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13544                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13545                                  					; call far 70:797h
 13546 0000155A A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 13547 0000155D 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 13548 0000155F 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 13549 00001561 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 13550 00001563 53                      		push	bx
 13551 00001564 51                      		push	cx
 13552 00001565 52                      		push	dx
 13553 00001566 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 13554                                  loop_ecc:				
 13555 00001569 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13556                                  
 13557                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 13558                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 13559                                  ;
 13560                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 13561                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 13562                                  ; track.
 13563                                  ;
 13564                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 13565                                  ; this request.
 13566                                  ;
 13567                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 13568                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 13569                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 13570                                  ;
 13571 0000156C E88DFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 13572                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 13573                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13574 0000156F 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13575                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13576 00001574 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 13577 00001576 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 13578 00001579 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 13579 0000157B 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 13580 0000157E 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 13581                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13582                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 13583                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 13584 00001580 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 13585                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 13586                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 13587                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 13588                                  ok11_op:				
 13589 00001582 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 13590 00001586 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 13591 00001588 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 13592                                  					; add 200h to address
 13593 0000158A FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13594 0000158C FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13595 0000158E EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 13596                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13597                                  
 13598                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 13599                                  
 13600                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 13601 00001590 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 13602                                  ok11_exit:				
 13603 00001591 5A                      		pop	dx
 13604 00001592 59                      		pop	cx
 13605 00001593 5B                      		pop	bx
 13606 00001594 EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13607                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13608                                  
 13609                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 13610                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 13611                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 13612                                  
 13613                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 13614 00001596 06                      		push	es
 13615 00001597 53                      		push	bx
 13616 00001598 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13617 0000159B 1E                      		push	ds
 13618 0000159C 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 13619 0000159D B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13620                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 13621                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13622 000015A0 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13623                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13624 000015A5 5B                      		pop	bx
 13625 000015A6 07                      		pop	es
 13626 000015A7 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 13627 000015A9 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 13628 000015AC 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 13629                                  
 13630                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 13631                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 13632                                  
 13633                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 13634 000015AE 56                      		push	si
 13635 000015AF 57                      		push	di
 13636 000015B0 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13637 000015B2 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13638 000015B5 E829FE                  		call	move_sector
 13639 000015B8 5F                      		pop	di
 13640 000015B9 5E                      		pop	si
 13641 000015BA EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 13642                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13643                                  
 13644                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 13645                                  ; operation as best we can.
 13646                                  
 13647                                  gotdmaerr:				
 13648 000015BC A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 13649 000015BF FB                      		sti
 13650 000015C0 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 13651 000015C3 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13652                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 13653                                  					; functions we don't handle
 13654 000015C5 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 13655 000015C8 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 13656 000015CA 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13657 000015CD 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 13658 000015CF 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13659                                  
 13660                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 13661                                  
 13662                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 13663                                  
 13664 000015D1 52                      		push	dx
 13665 000015D2 51                      		push	cx
 13666 000015D3 53                      		push	bx
 13667 000015D4 50                      		push	ax
 13668 000015D5 55                      		push	bp
 13669 000015D6 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 13670 000015D8 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 13671 000015DA D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13672 000015DC D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13673 000015DE D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13674 000015E0 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 13675 000015E2 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 13676 000015E4 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 13677                                  
 13678                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 13679                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 13680                                  
 13681 000015E8 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 13682 000015EA E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 13683                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13684                                  
 13685                                  no_skip_first:				
 13686 000015ED D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 13687 000015EF B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 13688 000015F1 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 13689                                  
 13690                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 13691                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 13692                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 13693                                  ;
 13694                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 13695                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 13696                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 13697                                  ; in error.
 13698                                  
 13699 000015F3 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 13700 000015F5 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 13701                                  
 13702                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 13703                                  
 13704 000015F7 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13705                                  					; set up head number
 13706 000015FA E888FE                  		call	doint
 13707 000015FD E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 13708                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13709                                  
 13710                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 13711 00001600 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 13712 00001602 F9                      		stc
 13713 00001603 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 13714                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 13715                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13716                                  
 13717                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 13718                                  
 13719                                  intverify:				
 13720 00001606 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 13721 00001607 53                      		push	bx
 13722 00001608 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 13723 00001609 07                      		pop	es
 13724                                  dosimple:				
 13725 0000160A BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13726                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 13727                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 13728                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13729 0000160D 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13730                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13731 00001612 5B                      		pop	bx
 13732 00001613 07                      		pop	es
 13733 00001614 E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13734                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13735                                  
 13736                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 13737                                  
 13738                                  intformat:				
 13739 00001617 06                      		push	es
 13740 00001618 53                      		push	bx
 13741 00001619 56                      		push	si
 13742 0000161A 57                      		push	di
 13743 0000161B 1E                      		push	ds
 13744                                  
 13745                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 13746                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 13747                                  
 13748 0000161C 06                      		push	es
 13749 0000161D 1E                      		push	ds
 13750 0000161E 07                      		pop	es
 13751 0000161F 1F                      		pop	ds
 13752 00001620 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 13753 00001622 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 13754 00001625 E8B9FD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 13755 00001628 1F                      		pop	ds
 13756 00001629 5F                      		pop	di
 13757 0000162A 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 13758 0000162B EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 13759                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13760                                  
 13761                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 13762                                  ; the first block.
 13763                                  ;
 13764                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 13765                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 13766                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 13767                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 13768                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 13769                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 13770                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 13771                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 13772                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 13773                                  
 13774                                  doblock:
 13775                                  
 13776                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 13777                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 13778                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 13779                                  				
 13780 0000162D 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13781                                  					; get head #, drive #
 13782 00001630 51                      		push	cx
 13783 00001631 06                      		push	es
 13784 00001632 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13785                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 13786 00001633 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 13787 00001636 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13788                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13789 0000163A 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13790                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13791 0000163F 5F                      		pop	di
 13792 00001640 07                      		pop	es
 13793 00001641 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 13794 00001643 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 13795 00001645 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 13796 00001647 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13797                                  doblockflop:				
 13798 00001649 59                      		pop	cx
 13799                                  doblockcontinue:			
 13800 0000164A 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 13801 0000164C 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 13802 0000164E 50                      		push	ax
 13803 0000164F 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 13804 00001651 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 13805                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13806                                  
 13807                                  doblocklast:				
 13808 00001653 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 13809 00001655 50                      		push	ax
 13810                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 13811 00001656 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 13812 00001659 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 13813 0000165B 58                      		pop	ax
 13814 0000165C 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 13815                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 13816 0000165F 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 13817 00001661 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 13818 00001663 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 13819 00001665 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 13820 00001667 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 13821                                  					; then we are done already.
 13822 00001669 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 13823                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 13824 0000166B E88EFD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 13825 0000166E EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 13826                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13827                                  
 13828                                  bufferx:				
 13829 00001670 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13830                                  					; set up head number
 13831                                  buffer:					
 13832 00001673 53                      		push	bx
 13833 00001674 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13834 00001677 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 13835 0000167A 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 13836                                  					
 13837                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 13838                                  
 13839 0000167C 06                      		push	es
 13840 0000167D 1E                      		push	ds
 13841 0000167E 56                      		push	si
 13842 0000167F 57                      		push	di
 13843 00001680 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 13844 00001681 06                      		push	es
 13845 00001682 1F                      		pop	ds
 13846 00001683 07                      		pop	es
 13847 00001684 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 13848 00001687 57                      		push	di		; save it
 13849 00001688 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 13850 0000168A E854FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 13851 0000168D 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 13852                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 13853 0000168E 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 13854 0000168F 5E                      		pop	si
 13855 00001690 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 13856                                  
 13857                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 13858                                  
 13859 00001691 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13860                                  					; get drive number
 13861 00001693 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 13862 00001696 E863FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 13863                                  					;
 13864                                  					; ah is	function
 13865                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 13866                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 13867                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 13868                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 13869                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 13870 00001699 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 13871 0000169C 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 13872 0000169D 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 13873 0000169F EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 13874                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13875                                  
 13876                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 13877                                  
 13878                                  doread:					
 13879 000016A1 06                      		push	es
 13880 000016A2 53                      		push	bx
 13881 000016A3 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 13882 000016A4 07                      		pop	es
 13883 000016A5 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13884 000016A8 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 13885 000016AA 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13886                                  					; get drive number
 13887 000016AD E84CFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 13888                                  					; ah = function
 13889                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 13890                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 13891                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 13892 000016B0 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 13893 000016B3 5B                      		pop	bx
 13894 000016B4 07                      		pop	es
 13895 000016B5 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 13896 000016B7 56                      		push	si
 13897 000016B8 57                      		push	di
 13898 000016B9 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13899 000016BB BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13900 000016BE E820FD                  		call	move_sector
 13901 000016C1 5F                      		pop	di
 13902 000016C2 5E                      		pop	si
 13903                                  
 13904                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 13905                                  
 13906                                  dotail:					
 13907 000016C3 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 13908 000016C4 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 13909 000016C7 41                      		inc	cx
 13910 000016C8 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 13911 000016CB F8                      		clc
 13912 000016CC FEC8                    		dec	al
 13913 000016CE 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 13914                                  
 13915                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 13916                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 13917                                  
 13918 000016D0 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13919 000016D3 E826FD                  		call	check_wrap
 13920 000016D6 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 13921                                  
 13922                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 13923                                  
 13924                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 13925                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 13926                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 13927                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 13928                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 13929                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 13930                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 13931                                  
 13932                                  bad13:					
 13933 000016D9 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 13934 000016DB 5D                      		pop	bp
 13935 000016DC 5B                      		pop	bx
 13936 000016DD 5B                      		pop	bx
 13937 000016DE 59                      		pop	cx
 13938 000016DF 5A                      		pop	dx
 13939 000016E0 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 13940 000016E2 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 13941                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13942                                  
 13943                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 13944 000016E5 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 13945                                  
 13946                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13947                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13948                                  		;db 	0
 13949                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13950                                  
 13951                                  ;Bios_Code ends

 13961                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 13962 000016E8 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 13963 000016EC BF[8706]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 13964 000016EF 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 13965 000016F0 07                      		pop	es
 13966 000016F1 E9C4EE                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 13967                                  
 13968                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13969                                  
 13970                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13971                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 13972                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 13973                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 13974                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13975                                  
 13976                                  install_bds:		
 13977 000016F4 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 13978 000016F5 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 13979                                  
 13980                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 13981                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 13982                                  loop_next_bds:				
 13983 000016F8 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 13984                                  					; fetch	next bds
 13985 000016FA 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13986 000016FE 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 13987                                  					; drive	with new one?
 13988 00001701 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 13989 00001703 B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 13990 00001705 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 13991                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 13992 00001709 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 13993 0000170C 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 13994                                  					; we don't own it
 13995 00001711 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 13996                                  					; determine if changeline available
 13997 00001714 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 13998 00001717 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 13999                                  next_bds:				
 14000 0000171B 833CFF                  		cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14001                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14002 0000171E 75D8                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14003 00001720 8C4402                  		mov	word [si+2], es ; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14004                                  					; install bds
 14005 00001723 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14006 00001725 26C705FFFF              		mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14007                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14008 0000172A 1F                      		pop	ds
 14009                                  
 14010                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 14011                                  ;
 14012                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 14013                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 14014                                  ;
 14015                                  ;		; 01/06/2019
 14016                                  ;		;mov	al,[es:di+52]
 14017                                  ;		mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 14018                                  ;
 14019                                  ;		cmp	al,[eot]
 14020                                  ;		jbe	short _eot_ok
 14021                                  ;		mov	[eot],al
 14022                                  
 14023 0000172B C3                      		retn
 14024

 14043 0000172C F606[CE08]01            swpdsk:		test	byte [IsWin386], 1			
 14044                                  		;test	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Is win386 present?
 14045 00001731 7405                    		jz	short no_win386	; no, skip SetFocus
 14046

 14048                                  		;;call	far 70h:8D1h	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:179Ah

 14057                                  					; get the drive	letter

 14060                                  ;           then existing dsk is drive A & vice versa

 14090                                  					; AL = character to display

 14128                                  
 14129                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14130                                  ; input : es:di points to current bds for drive.
 14131                                  ; return : zero set if no open files
 14132                                  ;	   zero reset if open files
 14133                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14134                                  
 14135                                  chkopcnt:
