 15169                                  struc	SYS_FCB
 15170 00000000 ??                      .fcb_drive:	resb 1
 15171 00000001 ????????????????        .fcb_name:	resb 8
 15172 00000009 ??????                  .fcb_ext:	resb 3
 15173 0000000C ????                    .fcb_EXTENT:	resw 1
 15174 0000000E ????                    .fcb_RECSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of record (user settable)
 15175 00000010 ????                    .fcb_FILSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of file in bytes; used with the following
 15176                                                          ; word
 15177 00000012 ????                    .fcb_DRVBP:	resw 1	; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
 15178 00000014 ????                    .fcb_FDATE:	resw 1	; Date of last writing
 15179 00000016 ????                    .fcb_FTIME:	resw 1	; Time of last writing
 15180 00000018 ??                      .fcb_DEVID:	resb 1	; Device ID number, bits 0-5 if file.
 15181                                                          ; bit 7=0 for file, bit 7=1 for I/O device
 15182                                                          ; If file, bit 6=0 if dirty
 15183                                                          ; If I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 15184                                                          ;               Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 15185                                                          ;               Bit 0=1 if console input device
 15186                                                          ;               Bit 1=1 if console output device
 15187                                                          ;               Bit 2=1 if null device
 15188                                                          ;               Bit 3=1 if clock device
 15189 00000019 ????                    .fcb_FIRCLUS:	resw 1	; First cluster of file
 15190 0000001B ????                    .fcb_CLUSPOS:	resw 1	; Position of last cluster accessed
 15191 0000001D ????                    .fcb_LSTCLUS:	resw 1	; Last cluster accessed and directory
 15192 0000001F ??                                   	resb 1	; pack 2 12 bit numbers into 24 bits...
 15193 00000020 ??                      .fcb_NR:	resb 1	; Next record
 15194 00000021 ????????                .fcb_RR:	resb 4	; Random record
 15195                                  .size:
 15196                                  endstruc
 15197                                  
 15198                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15199                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 15200                                  
 15201                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 15202                                  
 15203                                  struc buffinfo
 15204 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 15205 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 15206 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15207                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 15208                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 15209 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 15210                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 15211                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 15212                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 15213                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 15214                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 15215                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 15216                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 15217                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 15218 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15219                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 15220 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 15221 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 15222 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 15223 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 15224 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 15225                                  .size:
 15226                                  endstruc
 15227                                  
 15228                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 15229                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 15230                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 15231                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 15232                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 15233                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 15234                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 15235                                  
 15236                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 15237                                  
 15238                                  
 15239                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 15240                                  
 15241                                  ;Flag byte masks
 15242                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 15243                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 15244                                  ;***
 15245                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 15246                                  ;***
 15247                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 15248                                  
 15249                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 15250                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 15251                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 15252                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 15253                                  
 15254                                  buf_NetID	EQU	bufinsiz

 15257                                  
 15258                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15259                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 15260                                  
 15261                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 15262                                  
 15263                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 15264                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 15265                                  ;
 15266                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 15267                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 15268                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 15269                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 15270                                  ;
 15271                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 15272                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 15273                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 15274                                  
 15275                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 15276                                  
 15277                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15278                                  
 15279                                  struc	DPB
 15280 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 15281 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 15282 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 15283 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 15284 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 15285 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 15286 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 15287 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 15288 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 15289 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 15290                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15291 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 15292 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 15293 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 15294 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 15295 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 15296                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 15297 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 15298 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 15299 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 15300                                  .size:
 15301                                  endstruc
 15302                                  
 15303                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 15304                                  
 15305                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)
 15306

 15362                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 15363                                  
 15364                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 15365                                  ;
 15366                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 15367                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 15368                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 15369                                  ;
 15370                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 15371                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 15372                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 15373                                  ;
 15374                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 15375                                  
 15376                                  struc A_BPB
 15377 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 15378 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 15379 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 15380 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 15381 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 15382 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15383 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 15384 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 15385 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 15386 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 15387 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 15388 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 15389 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15390 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 15391 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 15392                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 15393                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 15394                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 15395                                  .size:
 15396                                  endstruc
 15397                                  
 15398                                  struc A_DEVICEPARAMETERS

 15400 00000001 ??                      .DP_DEVICETYPE:		resb	1
 15401 00000002 ????                    .DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES:	resw	1
 15402 00000004 ????                    .DP_CYLINDERS:		resw	1
 15403 00000006 ??                      .DP_MEDIATYPE:		resb	1
 15404 00000007 <res 1Fh>               .DP_BPB:		resb	A_BPB.size

 15655                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15656                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 15657                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15658                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 15659                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 15660                                  									  
 15661                                  ;*******************************					  
 15662                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 15663                                  ;*******************************					  
 15664                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 15665                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 15666                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 15667                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15668                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 15669                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 15670                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15671                                  ;For all others:							  
 15672                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 15673                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 15674                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 15675                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 15676                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 15677                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 15678                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 15679                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 15680                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15681                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 15682                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 15683                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 15684                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 15685                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 15686                                  ;									  
 15687                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 15688                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 15689                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15690                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 15691                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 15692                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 15693                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 15694                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 15695                                  ;									  
 15696                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 15697                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 15698                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 15699                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 15700                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 15701                                  ;									  
 15702                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 15703                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 15704                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 15705                                  ;									  
 15706                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 15707                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 15708                                  ;									  
 15709                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 15710                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 15711                                  ;									  
 15712                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 15713                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 15714                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 15715                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 15716                                  ;						called. 		  
 15717                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 15718                                  ;									  
 15719                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15720                                  ;									  
 15721                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15722                                  ;									  
 15723                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15724                                  ;									  
 15725                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15726                                  ;									  
 15727                                  
 15728                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 15729                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 15730 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 15731 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 15732                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 15733 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 15734 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 15735 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 15736 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 15737                                  endstruc					  
 15738

 15740                                  DMAchannel3		equ 10000000b					  
 15741                                  ScndIntController	equ 01000000b					  
 15742                                  RealTimeClock		equ 00100000b					  
 15743                                  KeyEscapeSeq		equ 00010000b					  
 15744                                  					;;End of Modification

 15846                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15847                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 15848                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15849                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15850                                  
 15851                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 15852                                  ;
 15853                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 15854                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 15855                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 15856                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 15857                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 15858                                  ;
 15859                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 15860                                  ;
 15861                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 15862                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 15863                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 15864                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 15865                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 15866                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 15867                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 15868                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 15869                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 15870                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 15871                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 15872                                  
 15873                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 15874                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 15875                                  
 15876                                  struc 		curdir_list
 15877                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15878 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 15879 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 15880 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 15881 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 15882 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 15883 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 15884                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 15885 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 15886 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 15887 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 15888                                  .size:
 15889                                  endstruc
 15890                                  
 15891                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 15892                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 15893                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 15894                                  						; argument
 15895                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 15896

 15906                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15907                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 15908                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15909                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15910                                  
 15911                                  ; system file table
 15912                                  
 15913                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 15914                                  ;
 15915                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 15916                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 15917                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 15918                                  
 15919                                  struc	SF
 15920 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 15921 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 15922 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 15923                                  .size:
 15924                                  endstruc
 15925                                  
 15926                                  ;**	System file table entry
 15927                                  ;
 15928                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 15929                                  
 15930                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 15931 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 15932                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 15933 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 15934 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 15935 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 15936                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 15937                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 15938                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 15939                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 15940                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 15941                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 15942                                  					;   (WRITE)
 15943                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 15944                                  					;
 15945                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 15946                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 15947                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 15948                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 15949                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 15950                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 15951                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 15952                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 15953                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 15954                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 15955                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 15956                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 15957 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 15958                                  					; to device header if local device,
 15959                                  					; points to net device header if
 15960                                  					; remote
 15961 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 15962                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 15963 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 15964 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 15965 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 15966 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 15967                                  ;
 15968                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 15969                                  ; ID
 15970                                  ;
 15971 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 15972 0000001B ????                    .sf_dirsec:	resw	1		; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 15973 0000001D ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 15974                                  ;
 15975                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 15976                                  ;
 15977 0000001E <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 15978                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 15979                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 15980                                  					; disk changed errors.
 15981                                  ; SHARING INFO
 15982 00000029 ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF
 15983 0000002D ????                    .sf_UID:	resw	1

 16261                                  	;IF	STACKSW 
 16262                                  	; include MSSTACK.INC	;Main stack program and data definitions

 16268                                  ; 05/07/2018
 16269                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16270                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 16271                                  
 16272                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16273                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 16274                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16275                                  
 16276                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 16277                                  ;
 16278                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 16279                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 16280                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 16281                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 16282                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 16283                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 16284                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 16285                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 16286                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 16287                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 16288                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 16289                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 16290                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 16291                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 16292                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 16293                                  ;
 16294                                  
 16295                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 16296                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 16297                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 16298                                  ;
 16299                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 16300                                  ;
 16301                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 16302                                  ;
 16303                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 16304                                  ;
 16305                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 16306                                  ;
 16307                                  
 16308                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 16309                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 16310                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 16311                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 16312                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 16313                                  ;      deeply nested one
 16314                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 16315                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 16316                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 16317                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 16318                                  
 16319                                  		;EVEN
 16320                                  ;align 2
 16321                                  		; 21/10/2022
 16322                                  
 16323 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 16324 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 16325 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 16326 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 16327 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 16328 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 16329                                  
 16330 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 16331 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16332 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16333                                  
 16334                                  ;***********************************************************************
 16335                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 16336                                  
 16337                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16338                                  
 16339 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 16340                                  
 16341                                  int02:
 16342                                  
 16343                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16344                                  ;
 16345                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 16346                                  ;
 16347                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 16348                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 16349                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 16350                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 16351                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 16352                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 16353                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 16354                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 16355                                  ;
 16356                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 16357                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 16358                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 16359                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 16360                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 16361                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 16362                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 16363                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 16364                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 16365                                  ;
 16366                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16367                                  
 16368 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 16369 00000017 06                      	push	es
 16370 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 16371 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 16372                                  	; 02/11/2022
 16373 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 16374 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 16375 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 16376                                  
 16377 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 16378                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 16379                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 16380                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 16381                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 16382 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 16383 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 16384                                  special02:
 16385 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax
 16386 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]
 16387                                  normal02:
 16388 00000032 58                      	pop	ax
 16389 00000033 E81101                  	call	do_int_stacks
 16390 00000036 [1200]                  	dw	old02

 16616                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16617                                  
 16618                                  ;********************************************************************
 16619                                  ;common routines
 16620                                  ;********************************************************************
 16621                                  
 16622                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 16623                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 16624                                  ; service routine
 16625                                  
 16626                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 16627                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16628                                  
 16629                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 16630                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 16631                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 16632                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 16633                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 16634                                  
 16635                                  do_int_stacks:
 16636 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 16637 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 16638 00000149 06                      	push	es
 16639 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 16640 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 16641 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 16642                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16643                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 16644                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16645 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 16646 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 16647 0000015C 754F                    	jne	short notfree02
 16648                                  
 16649 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 16650                                  
 16651                                  found02:
 16652 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 16653 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 16654                                  
 16655 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 16656                                  
 16657 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 16658                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16659                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 16660                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16661                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 16662 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 16663 00000176 7542                    	jne	short foundbad02
 16664                                  
 16665                                  	;mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 16666                                  	;mov	es,bp
 16667                                  	;mov	bp,sp
 16668                                  	;mov	bp,[bp+6]
 16669                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 16670                                  	;mov	sp,es
 16671                                  	;mov	es,ax
 16672                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 16673                                  
 16674                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 code SYSINIT code)
 16675 00000178 55                      	push    bp
 16676 00000179 89E5                    	mov     bp,sp
 16677 0000017B 8B4608                  	mov     ax,[bp+8]
 16678 0000017E 5D                      	pop     bp
 16679 0000017F 06                      	push    es
 16680 00000180 17                      	pop     ss
 16681 00000181 89EC                    	mov     sp,bp
 16682 00000183 89C5                    	mov     bp,ax
 16683                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16684                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 16685 00000185 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 16686                                  
 16687 00000189 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 16688                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16689 0000018A 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 16690                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16691                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 16692                                  
 16693 0000018E 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 16694                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16695 00000190 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 16696                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16697                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 16698 00000194 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 16699 00000198 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 16700                                  
 16701                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16702                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 16703                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16704 0000019C 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 16705 000001A1 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 16706                                  
 16707 000001A6 07                      	pop	es
 16708 000001A7 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 16709 000001A8 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 16710 000001A9 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 16711 000001AC CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 16712                                  
 16713                                  notfree02:
 16714 000001AD 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 16715 000001AF 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 16716                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16717                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 16718                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16719 000001B1 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 16720                                  
 16721                                  findnext02:
 16722 000001B5 E81200                  	call	longpath
 16723 000001B8 EBAA                    	jmp	short found02
 16724                                  
 16725                                  foundbad02:
 16726 000001BA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 16727 000001BF 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 16728 000001C1 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 16729                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16730                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 16731                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16732 000001C3 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 16733 000001C8 EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 16734                                  
 16735                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16736                                  
 16737                                  ; Common routines
 16738                                  
 16739                                  longpath:
 16740                                  	; 21/03/2019
 16741 000001CA 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 16742                                  lploopp:
 16743                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16744                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 16745                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16746 000001CF 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 16747 000001D4 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 16748                                  
 16749 000001D6 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 16750                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16751                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 16752                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16753 000001D8 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 16754 000001DC 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 16755 000001DE 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 16756                                  
 16757 000001E0 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 16758 000001E2 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 16759                                  
 16760                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16761                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 16762                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16763 000001E4 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 16764                                  inuse:
 16765 000001E8 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 16766 000001ED 7406                    	je	short fatal
 16767 000001EF 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 16768 000001F2 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 16769                                  found:
 16770 000001F4 C3                      	retn
 16771                                  fatal:

 16774 000001F9 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 16775 000001FB 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 16776 00000200 1F                      	pop	ds
 16777 00000201 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 16778                                  
 16779 00000203 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable pc convertible nmis
 16780 00000205 E672                    	out	72h,al
 16781

 16784 00000208 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints

 17974                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 17975                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 17976                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 17977                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 17978                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 17979                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 17980                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 17981                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 17982                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 17983                                  ;
 17984                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 17985                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 17986                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 17987                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 17988                                  ; been patched.

 18274 000007DD BA[D534]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 18275                                  
 18276                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 18277                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 18278                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 18279                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 18280                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 18281                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 18282                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 18283                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 18284                                  
 18285                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 18286                                  
 18287 000007E0 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 18288 000007E1 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh

 18291 000007E8 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 18292 000007EA CD21                    	int	21h		; second time gets it
 18293 000007EC 7243                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 18294

 18298 000007F4 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 18299                                  
 18300                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 18301                                  
 18302                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 18303                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 18304                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 18305                                  
 18306                                  	; 22/10/2022
 18307                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)

 18309 000007FA 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 18310                                  
 18311                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 18312                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 18313                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 18314                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 18315                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 18316                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 18317                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 18318                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 18319                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 18320                                  ;
 18321                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 18322                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 18323                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 18324                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 18325                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 18326                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 18327                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 18328                                  
 18329                                  	; 22/10/2022

 18573                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18574                                  ; procedure : AllocFreeMem
 18575                                  ;
 18576                                  ; Allocate Max memory from DOS to find out where to load DOS.
 18577                                  ; DOS is at temporary location when this call is being made
 18578                                  ;
 18579                                  ; Inputs : None
 18580                                  ; Outputs: The biggest chunk of memory is allocated (all mem at init time)
 18581                                  ;	   [area] & [memhi] set to the para value of the start of the
 18582                                  ;	   free memory.
 18583                                  ;
 18584                                  ; Uses   : AX, BX
 18585                                  ;
 18586                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18587                                  
 18588                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18589                                  AllocFreeMem:

 18591 00000859 B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC

 18593 0000085D B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 18594 0000085F CD21                    	int	21h			; second time gets it
 18595                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18596                                  	; ds = cs
 18597                                  	;mov	[cs:area],ax
 18598                                  	;mov	[cs:memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to
 18599 00000861 A3[E403]                	mov	[area],ax
 18600 00000864 A3[E003]                	mov	[memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to			
 18601 00000867 C3                      	retn				; start of free memory
 18602

 18669                                  ;
 18670                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 18671                                  ;
 18672                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 18673                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 18674                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 18675                                  ;
 18676                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 18677                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 18678                                  ; 
 18679                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18680                                  
 18681                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18682                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:092Ah)
 18683                                  TryToMovDOSHi:
 18684                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18685                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18686                                  	; ds = cs
 18687 000008DD E81300                  	call	MovDOSHi
 18688 000008E0 7210                    	jc	short ttldhx
 18689                                  
 18690                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 18691                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18692                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION] ; give dos its temporary loc.
 18693                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18694                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18695                                  	; ds = cs
 18696 000008E2 8E06[7102]              	mov	es,[CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION]
 18697                                  ;else
 18698                                  ;	..
 18699                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 18700                                  
 18701                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18702                                  	; ds = cs
 18703 000008E6 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; ax = 00 ---> install stub
 18704                                  	;call	far [cs:dos_segreinit]	; call dos segreinit
 18705 000008E8 FF1E[7B02]              	call	far [dos_segreinit]
 18706                                  	;mov	byte [cs:runhigh],1
 18707 000008EC C606[6A02]01            	mov	byte [runhigh],1
 18708 000008F1 F8                      	clc
 18709                                  ttldhx:
 18710 000008F2 C3                      	retn

 18712                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18713                                  ;
 18714                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 18715                                  ;
 18716                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 18717                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 18718                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 18719                                  ;
 18720                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed
 18721                                  ;
 18722                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18723                                  
 18724                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18725                                  MovDOSHi:
 18726                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18727                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18728                                  	; ds = cs
 18729 000008F3 E8D800                  	call	AllocHMA
 18730 000008F6 7213                    	jc	short mdhx			; did we get HMA?
 18731 000008F8 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh			; yes, HMA seg = 0ffffh
 18732 000008FB 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18733                                  
 18734                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 18735                                  	; actually move the BIOS and DOS
 18736                                  
 18737                                  	; NOTE: Retro DOS v4.0 does not move BIOS (IO.SYS) to HMA
 18738                                  	; 24/03/2019
 18739                                  	
 18740                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18741 000008FD E83400                  	call	MovBIOS				; First move BIOS into HMA
 18742                                  
 18743                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after BIOS
 18744                                  	
 18745                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18746                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18747                                  	;xor	di,di
 18748                                  	
 18749                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18750                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:hi_doscod_size]		; pass the code size of DOS
 18751                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18752                                  	; ds = cs
 18753 00000900 8B0E[8102]              	mov	cx,[hi_doscod_size]		; when it is in HMA
 18754 00000904 E81100                  	call	MovDOS				; and move it
 18755                                  
 18756                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after DOS
 18757                                  ;else
 18758                                  ;	; allocate space at beginning of HMA to allow for CPMHack
 18759                                  ;
 18760                                  ;	mov	di,0E0h				; room for 5 bytes at ffff:d0
 18761                                  ;
 18762                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 18763                                  
 18764 00000907 E86202                  	call	SaveFreeHMAPtr			; Save the Free HMA ptr
 18765 0000090A F8                      	clc
 18766                                  mdhx:
 18767 0000090B C3                      	retn

 18823                                  ;
 18824                                  ; procedure : MovDOS
 18825                                  ;
 18826                                  ;		Moves DOS code into requested area
 18827                                  ;
 18828                                  ;	In : ES:DI - pointer to memory where DOS is to be moved
 18829                                  ;	     CX    - size of DOS code to be moved
 18830                                  ;
 18831                                  ;	Out : ES:DI - pointer to memory immediately after DOS
 18832                                  ;
 18833                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18834                                  
 18835                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18836                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18837

 18839

 18841                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18842                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18843

 18846

 18848                                  	;push	ds ; *//
 18849

 18855                                  
 18856                                  	; 29/04/2019
 18857 0000091B C536[6F02]              	lds	si,[dosinit] ; 11/12/2022
 18858                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18859                                  	;lds	si,[cs:dosinit]
 18860                                  	;;mov	ax,si
 18861                                  
 18862 0000091F F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 18863                                  
 18864 00000921 1F                      	pop	ds ; *// ; 11/12/2022
 18865                                  
 18866 00000922 5B                      	pop	bx				; get back offset into which
 18867                                  						;  DOS was moved
 18868                                  
 18869 00000923 2EA1[6F02]              	mov	ax,[cs:dosinit]			; get the offset at which DOS
 18870                                  						;  wants to run

 18874                                  						;  we moved DOS into

 18876

 18878                                  	; 23/10/2022

 18887                                  	;mov	[FINAL_DOS_LOCATION],bx
 18888                                  
 18889 00000933 C3                      	retn
 18890                                  
 18891                                  ;endif ;ROMDOS

 18894                                  ; 24/03/2019
 18895                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18896                                  ;
 18897                                  ; procedure : MovBIOS
 18898                                  ;
 18899                                  ;		Moves BIOS code into requested segment
 18900                                  ;
 18901                                  ;	In : ES - segment to which BIOS is to be moved
 18902                                  ;		  ( it moves always into offset BCode_Start)
 18903                                  ;
 18904                                  ;	Out : ES:DI - pointer to memory immediately after BIOS

 19087                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 19088                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 19089                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 19090                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 19091                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 19092                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 19093                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 19094                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 19095                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 19096                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 19097                                  ;	  stub will go.
 19098                                  ;
 19099                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 19100                                  
 19101                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19102                                  update_arena:
 19103 00000987 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 19104 00000988 57                      	push	di
 19105 00000989 51                      	push	cx
 19106 0000098A 52                      	push	dx
 19107                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19108                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 19109                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19110                                  	; ds = cs 
 19111 0000098B C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 19112 0000098F 4F                      	dec	di
 19113 00000990 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 19114                                  						;  before sysvar
 19115 00000991 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 19116                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 19117 00000993 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 19118 00000998 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 19119 0000099A 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 19120                                  
 19121                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 19122 0000099C 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 19123 000009A1 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 19124 000009A3 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 19125 000009A5 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 19126 000009A7 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19127                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 19128 000009A9 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 19129                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 19130 000009AD C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 19131 000009B3 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 19132                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 19133 000009B5 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 19134 000009B9 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 19135                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19136                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 19137 000009BB 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 19138 000009BE 5A                      	pop	dx
 19139 000009BF 59                      	pop	cx
 19140 000009C0 5F                      	pop	di
 19141 000009C1 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 19142 000009C2 C3                      	retn
 19143                                  ;
 19144                                  ; M012 : END
 19145                                  ;

 19162                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19163                                  ;
 19164                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19165                                  ;
 19166                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19167                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19168                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19169                                  ;
 19170                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 19171                                  ;
 19172                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19173                                  
 19174                                  AllocHMA:
 19175                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 19176                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 19177                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 19178                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 19179                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 19180                                  
 19181                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 19182                                  ;
 19183                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 19184                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 19185                                  ;	push	ax
 19186                                  ;	popf
 19187                                  ;	pushf
 19188                                  ;	pop	ax
 19189                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 19190                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 19191                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 19192                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 19193                                  
 19194                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19195                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 19196                                  
 19197 000009CE 1E                      	push	ds
 19198                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 19199                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 19200                                  	; 21/10/2022
 19201 000009CF B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 19202 000009D2 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19203                                  
 19204 000009D4 E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 19205 000009D7 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 19206                                  
 19207 000009D9 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 19208 000009DC CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 19209                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 19210                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 19211                                  
 19212 000009DE 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 19213                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 19214 000009E2 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 19215                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 19216                                  
 19217 000009E6 B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 19218 000009E8 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 19219                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19220 000009EB FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19221 000009EF 48                      	dec	ax
 19222 000009F0 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 19223                                  
 19224                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 19225                                  
 19226 000009F2 B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 19227 000009F4 CD15                    	int	15h
 19228                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 19229                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 19230                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 19231 000009F6 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 19232                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 19233                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19234 000009F9 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 19235                                  allocHMA_1:
 19236 000009FB B405                    	mov	ah,5		; localenableA20
 19237                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19238 000009FD FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19239 00000A01 48                      	dec	ax
 19240 00000A02 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 19241                                  
 19242 00000A04 E88901                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 19243 00000A07 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 19244                                  
 19245 00000A09 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 19246 00000A0C 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19247 00000A0E 26C70610003412          	mov	word [es:10h],1234h ; see if we can really read/write there
 19248 00000A15 26813E10003412          	cmp	word [es:10h],1234h
 19249                                  	;jne	short grabhma_error ; don't try to load there if XMS lied
 19250                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19251 00000A1C 7401                    	je	short allocHMA_ok	
 19252                                  
 19253                                  ; 11/12/2022
 19254                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 19255                                  ;	; cf=0
 19256                                  ;	;clc
 19257                                  ;	pop	ds
 19258                                  ;	retn
 19259                                  
 19260                                  grabhma_error:
 19261 00000A1E F9                      	stc
 19262                                  	; 11/12/022
 19263                                  grabhma_err:	; cf=1
 19264                                  allocHMA_ok:	; cf=0
 19265 00000A1F 1F                      	pop	ds
 19266 00000A20 C3                      	retn

 19271                                  ;

 19275                                  ;           Z flag reset if no XMS drivers are present
