 19331 00000A45 CB                      	retf
 19332                                  
 19333                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19334                                  ;
 19335                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19336                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19337                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19338                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19339                                  ;
 19340                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19341                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19342                                  ;
 19343                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19344                                  
 19345                                  StartVDHead:
 19346                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19347                                  
 19348 00000A46 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19349 00000A4A 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19350 00000A4C 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19351 00000A4E 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19352 00000A50 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19353                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19354 00000A51 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19355                                  VDiskSig1:
 19356 00000A58 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19357                                  
 19358                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19359                                  
 19360 00000A5D 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19361                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19362 00000A63 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19363 00000A72 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19364 00000A74 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19365                                  VDInt19:
 19366 00000A75 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19367                                  OldVDInt19:
 19368 00000A76 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 19369                                  
 19370                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 19371                                  
 19372                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 19373 00000A7A 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 19374                                  VDiskSig2:
 19375 00000A7D 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19376                                  
 19377                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 19378                                  
 19379 00000A82 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 19380 00000A85 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 19381 00000A87 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 19382 00000A88 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 19383 00000A8A 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 19384 00000A8B 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 19385 00000A8D 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 19386 00000A8F FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 19387 00000A90 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 19388 00000A92 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 19389 00000A94 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 19390 00000A96 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 19391 00000A98 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 19392                                  
 19393                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 19394                                  
 19395                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19396                                  ;
 19397                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19398                                  ;
 19399                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19400                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19401                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 19402                                  ;
 19403                                  ; Inputs : None
 19404                                  ;
 19405                                  ; Outputs : None
 19406                                  ;
 19407                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 19408                                  ;
 19409                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19410                                  
 19411                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19412                                  
 19413                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 19414 00000A9A 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 19415 00000A9C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 19416                                  
 19417                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 19418                                  
 19419                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19420 00000A9E A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 19421                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax

 19531                                  
 19532                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19533                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 19534                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 19535                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 19536                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 19537                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 19538                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 19539                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 19540                                  ;								      ;I070
 19541                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 19542                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 19543                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 19544                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 19545                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 19546                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 19547                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 19548                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 19549                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 19550                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 19551                                  ;								      ;I070
 19552                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 19553                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19554

 19598                                  ;		the offset.

 19907                                  ; installable device drivers have been loaded (but before "install="

 19910                                  ; to allow for the safe EXECing of "install=" programs. All memory

 20289                                  ;*******************************************************************************

 20291                                  ; function: actually allocate buffers in the memory and initialize it. 	       *
 20292                                  ; input :								       *
 20293                                  ;    memhi:memlo - start of the next available memory			       *
 20294                                  ;    buffers = number of buffers					       *
 20295                                  ;    h_buffers = number of secondary buffers				       *
 20296                                  ;									       *

 20299                                  ;	buffinfo set.							       *

 20551                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 20552                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 20553                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 20554                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 20555                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 20556                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 20557                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 20558                                  ;
 20559                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 20560                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 20561                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 20562                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 20563                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 20564                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 20565                                  ;
 20566                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 20567                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 20568                                  ;
 20569                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 20570                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 20571                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 20572                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 20573                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 20574                                  ;
 20575                                  ;	for round-up machine
 20576                                  ;
 20577                                  ;			  none.
 20578                                  
 20579                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 20580                                  ;
 20581                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 20582                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 20583

 20752                                  ;memory allocation for sysinit,confbot module.
 20753                                  
 20754 0000101C 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20755                                  	;mov	bx,[CONFBOT]
 20756                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20757 0000101E 8B1E[A102]              	mov	bx,[top_of_cdss]
 20758 00001022 29C3                    	sub	bx,ax			; confbot - memhi
 20759 00001024 4B                      	dec	bx			; make a room for the memory block id.
 20760 00001025 4B                      	dec	bx			; make sure!!!.
 20761 00001026 B44A                    	mov	ah,4Ah ; SETBLOCK
 20762 00001028 CD21                    	int	21h			; this will free (confbot to top of memory)
 20763                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ADJUST MEMORY BLOCK SIZE (SETBLOCK)
 20764                                  		; ES = segment address of block to change
 20765                                  		; BX = new size in paragraphs

 20767 0000102D B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 20768 0000102F CD21                    	int	21h
 20769 00001031 B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 20770 00001033 CD21                    	int	21h			; allocate (confbot to top of memory)
 20771                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ALLOCATE MEMORY
 20772                                  		; BX = number of 16-byte paragraphs desired
 20773 00001035 A3[E403]                	mov	[area],ax		; save allocated memory segment.
 20774                                  					; need this to free this area for command.com.
 20775 00001038 8E06[E003]              	mov	es,[memhi]
 20776 0000103C B449                    	mov	ah,49h			; free allocated memory.
 20777 0000103E CD21                    	int	21h			; free (memhi to confbot(=area))
 20778                                  		; DOS - 2+ - FREE MEMORY
 20779                                  		; ES = segment address of area to be freed
 20780                                  endfile_ret:
 20781 00001040 C3                      	retn

 20785                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20786                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20787                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 20788                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20789                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 20790                                  ;
 20791                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 20792                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 20793                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 20794                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 20795                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 20796                                  ; program).
 20797                                  
 20798                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 20799                                  
 20800                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 20801                                  
 20802 00001041 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 20803                                  
 20804                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 20805                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 20806                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 20807                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 20808                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 20809                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 20810                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 20811                                  ; carridge return.
 20812                                  
 20813                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 20814                                  ;character after =.
 20815                                  
 20816 00001042 06                      	push	es
 20817 00001043 1E                      	push	ds
 20818 00001044 07                      	pop	es
 20819 00001045 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 20820 00001046 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 20821                                  
 20822 00001048 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 20823 0000104A FC                      	cld
 20824 0000104B 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 20825 00001051 BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 20826                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 20827 00001054 AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 20828 00001055 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 20829 00001057 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 20830 00001059 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 20831                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 20832 0000105B AC                      	lodsb
 20833 0000105C 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 20834 0000105F 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 20835 00001061 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 20836 00001063 FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 20837 00001065 47                      	inc	di
 20838 00001066 EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 20839                                  done_installparm:
 20840 00001068 2E880E[6C03]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 20841 0000106D 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 20842 00001070 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 20843 00001072 2EC606[6D03]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 20844                                  					; starts with cr.
 20845                                  install_seg_set:
 20846 00001078 2EC70600000000          	mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment
 20847 0000107F 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.
 20848                                  
 20849                                  ;---------------------------------------------------M067----------------
 20850                                  ;
 20851                                  ; 	the environment pointer is made 0. so the current environment ptr.
 20852                                  ; 	will be the same as pdb_environ which after dosinit is 0.
 20853                                  ;
 20854                                  ; 	mov	cs:[instexe.exec0_environ],0 ; set the environment seg.
 20855                                  ;
 20856                                  ; 	instexe.exec0_environ need not be initialized to 0 above. It was
 20857                                  ; 	done as a fix for bug #529. The actual bug was in NLSFUNC and
 20858                                  ; 	was fixed. 
 20859                                  ;
 20860                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20861                                  
 20862                                  ;;ifdef   MULTI_CONFIG
 20863                                  
 20864                                  ; If there's any environment data in "config_wrkseg", pass to app
 20865

 20867                                          ;mov     cx,ax

 20869                                          ;je      short no_envdata2
 20870                                          ;mov     cx,[cs:config_wrkseg]
 20871                                  ;no_envdata2:
 20872                                  ;;endif  ;MULTI_CONFIG
 20873                                  
 20874                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_environ],cx ; set the environment seg.
 20875                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20876                                  	;mov	[cs:iexec.environ],cx
 20877                                  	; 02/11/2022
 20878 00001081 2EA3[BE03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.environ],ax	
 20879                                  
 20880                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_com_line+2],ax ; set the seg.
 20881 00001085 2EA3[C203]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_line+2],ax
 20882                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_5c_fcb+2],ax
 20883 00001089 2EA3[C603]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_5c_fcb+2],ax
 20884                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_6c_fcb+2],ax
 20885 0000108D 2EA3[CA03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_6c_fcb+2],ax
 20886 00001091 E86E00                  	call	sum_up
 20887 00001094 26A3[5603]              	mov	[es:checksum],ax	; save the value of the sum
 20888 00001098 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20889 0000109A B44B                    	mov	ah,4Bh ; EXEC		; load/exec
 20890 0000109C BB[BE03]                	mov	bx,instexe		; es:bx -> parm block.
 20891 0000109F 06                      	push	es			; save es,ds for load/exec
 20892 000010A0 1E                      	push	ds			; these registers will be restored in sysinit_base.
 20893 000010A1 2EFF2E[4E03]            	jmp	far [cs:sysinit_base_ptr] ; jmp to sysinit_base to execute
 20894                                  					; load/exec function and check sum.
 20895                                  
 20896                                  ;----------------------------------------
 20897                                  
 20898                                  ;j.k. this is the returning address from sysinit_base.
 20899                                  
 20900                                  	; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 20901                                  
 20902                                  sysinitptr:				; returning far address from sysinit_base
 20903 000010A6 5E                      	pop	si			; restore si for config.sys file.
 20904 000010A7 06                      	push	es
 20905 000010A8 1E                      	push	ds
 20906 000010A9 07                      	pop	es
 20907 000010AA 1F                      	pop	ds			; now ds - sysinitseg, es - confbot
 20908 000010AB 7306                            jnc     short install_exit_ret
 20909

 20911 000010AE E8AE22                  	call	badload 		; es:si-> path,filename,0.
 20912 000010B1 5E                      	pop	si
 20913

 20918 000010B2 C3                      	retn
 20919                                  
 20920                                  install_exit_ret:

 20924                                  ;SYSINIT:1142h:
 20925 000010B3 B44D                    	mov     ah,4Dh

 20927 000010B7 80FC03                  	cmp     ah,3
 20928 000010BA 7404                    	jz      short sysinitptr_retn
 20929 000010BC E89316                  	call    error_line
 20930 000010BF F9                      	stc
 20931                                  sysinitptr_retn:	; (SYSINIT:114Fh)
 20932 000010C0 C3                      	retn

 20934                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20935                                  
 20936                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 20937                                  ;
 20938                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 20939                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 20940                                  ;
 20941                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 20942                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 20943                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 20944                                  
 20945                                  ParaRound:
 20946 000010C1 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 20947 000010C4 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 20948 000010C6 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20949 000010C8 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20950 000010CA D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20951 000010CC C3                      	retn
 20952                                  
 20953                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20954                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 20955                                  ;
 20956                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 20957                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 20958                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 20959                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 20960                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 20961                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 20962                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 20963                                  ;
 20964                                  ;in: after relocation,
 20965                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 20966                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 20967                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 20968                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 20969                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 20970                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 20971                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 20972                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 20973                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 20974                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 20975                                  ;
 20976                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 20977                                  
 20978                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20979                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 20980                                  sysinit_base:				
 20981 000010CD 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 20982 000010D2 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 20983 000010D7 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 20984 000010D9 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 20985 000010DE 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 20986 000010E3 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 20987 000010E4 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 20988 000010E5 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 20989                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 20990                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 20991 000010E7 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 20992 000010EA 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 20993 000010EF 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 20994                                  
 20995                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 20996                                  
 20997 000010F1 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 20998 000010F3 0E                      	push	cs
 20999 000010F4 1F                      	pop	ds
 21000 000010F5 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21001 000010F8 CD21                    	int	21h
 21002                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21003                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21004                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21005                                  _stall: 
 21006                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21007 000010FA F4                      	hlt 
 21008                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21009                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 21010 000010FB EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 21011                                  
 21012                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 21013 000010FD 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 21014                                  
 21015                                  ;-------------------------------------
 21016                                  
 21017                                  sum_up:
 21018                                  
 21019                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21020                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21021                                  ;
 21022                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21023                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21024                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21025                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21026                                  ;
 21027                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21028                                  
 21029 00001102 1E                      	push	ds
 21030                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21031                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21032 00001103 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21033 00001107 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21034 00001109 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21035 0000110B 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21036 0000110D 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21037                                  					;whole test better fail.
 21038 00001112 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21039 00001114 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21040                                  sum1:
 21041 00001116 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21042 00001118 46                      	inc	si
 21043 00001119 46                      	inc	si
 21044 0000111A E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21045                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21046                                  sum_sys_code:
 21047                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21048 0000111C BE1C11                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21049                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21050                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21051                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21052                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21053                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21054                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 21055                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 21056 0000111F B9[6039]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 21057 00001122 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 21058 00001124 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 21059                                  sum2:
 21060 00001126 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 21061 00001129 46                      	inc	si
 21062 0000112A 46                      	inc	si
 21063 0000112B E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 21064 0000112D 1F                      	pop	ds
 21065 0000112E C3                      	retn
 21066                                  
 21067                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21068                                  
 21069                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 21070                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:
 21071 0000112F 0000                    	dw	0
 21072                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 21073                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:

 21088                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21089                                  ; Set_Buffer
 21090                                  ;
 21091                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 21092                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 21093                                  ;
 21094                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 21095                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 21096                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 21097                                  ;
 21098                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 21099                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 21100                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 21161                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21162                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21163                                  ;
 21164                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21165                                  ;
 21166                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 21167                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 21168                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21169                                  
 21170                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21171                                  GetBufferAddr:
 21172 000011A8 53                      	push	bx
 21173 000011A9 52                      	push	dx
 21174 000011AA 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 21175 000011AE 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 21176                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 21177 000011B3 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 21178                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21179                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21180                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21181 000011B6 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 21182 000011B8 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21183 000011BA B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 21184                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 21185 000011BD CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 21186 000011BF 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 21187 000011C2 7508                    	jne	short got_hma
 21188 000011C4 BF0000                  	mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 21189                                  	;zf=1
 21190                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 21191                                  	;zf=1

 21225                                  
 21226                                  ; ======================================================================
 21227                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21228                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21229                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21230                                  
 21231                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21232                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21233                                  ;
 21234                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21235                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21236                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21237                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21238                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21239                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21240                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21241                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21242                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21243                                  ;
 21244                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21245                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21246                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21247                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21248                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21249                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21250                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21251                                  ;	conditions:
 21252                                  ;
 21253                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21254                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21255                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21256                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21257                                  ;
 21258                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21259                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21260                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21261                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21262                                  ;
 21263                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21264                                  ;
 21265                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21266                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21267                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21268                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21269                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21270                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21271                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21272                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21273                                  ;
 21274                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21275                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21276                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21277                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21278                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21279                                  ;
 21280                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21281                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21282                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21283                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21284                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21285                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21286                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21287                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21288                                  ;
 21289                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21290                                  
 21291                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21292                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21293                                  
 21294                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21295                                  stackinit:
 21296 000011F7 50                      	push	ax
 21297 000011F8 1E                      	push	ds
 21298 000011F9 06                      	push	es
 21299 000011FA 53                      	push	bx
 21300 000011FB 51                      	push	cx
 21301 000011FC 52                      	push	dx
 21302 000011FD 57                      	push	di
 21303 000011FE 56                      	push	si
 21304 000011FF 55                      	push	bp
 21305                                  
 21306                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21307                                  
 21308                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21309                                  	; ds = cs
 21310 00001200 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 21311 00001203 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 21312                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21313                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 21314                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 21315 00001205 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 21316                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 21317 00001209 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 21318 0000120C 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 21319                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21320 00001210 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 21321                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21322                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21323                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 21324 00001213 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 21325                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21326 00001217 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 21327 00001219 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 21328                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21329                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21330                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 21331 0000121C 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax

 21334

 21343

 21355

 21363

 21365

 21369

 21372                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 21373                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 21374                                  ;  cx = number of entries

 22126                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22127                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22128                                  
 22129                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22130                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22131                                  
 22132                                  new_init_loop:
 22133                                  
 22134                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22135                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22136                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22137                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22138                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22139                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22140                                  
 22141 000013EC 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22142 000013EF 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22143 000013F1 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22144 000013F5 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22145                                  
 22146 000013F8 1E                      	push	ds
 22147                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22148                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22149                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22150 000013F9 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22151 000013FC 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22152 000013FE 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22153 00001401 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22154 00001403 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22155 00001407 894502                  	mov	word [di+2],ax
 22156 0000140A 1F                      	pop	ds
 22157                                  
 22158 0000140B 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22159 0000140E 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22160 00001412 C3                      	retn
 22161                                  
 22162                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22163                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22164                                  
 22165                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22166                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22167                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22168                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22169                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22170                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22171                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22172                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 22173                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22174                                  
 22175                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22176                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 22177                                  
 22178                                  setdevmark:
 22179                                  
 22180 00001413 06                      	push	es
 22181 00001414 51                      	push	cx
 22182                                  
 22183 00001415 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22184 0000141A 2E890E[3414]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22185 0000141F 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22186                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22187                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22188 00001421 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22189 00001425 41                      	inc	cx
 22190                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22191 00001426 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22192                                  
 22193 0000142B 59                      	pop	cx
 22194 0000142C 07                      	pop	es
 22195 0000142D 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22196 00001432 C3                      	retn
 22197

 22273 00001437 0000                    badparm_off:	dw  0
 22274 00001439 0000                    badparm_seg:	dw  0

 22396                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22397                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 22398                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 22399                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 22400                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22401                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 22402                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 22403                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 22404                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22405                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 22406                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22407                                  
 22408                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 22409                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 22410 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 22411 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 22412 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 22413                                  endstruc

 22418                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 22419

 22421                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 22422                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 22423                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 22424                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 22425                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 22426                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 22427                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 22428                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 22429                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 22430                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES

 22433                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 22434                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 22435 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 22436 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 22437 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 22438                                  endstruc
 22439                                  
 22440                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22441                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 22442                                  ;
 22443                                  ;
 22444                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 22445                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 22446                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22447                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22448                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22449                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22450                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22451                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22452                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22453                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22454                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22455                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22456                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22457                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22458                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22459                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22460                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22461                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22462                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22463                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22464                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22465                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22466                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22467                                  ;	   :
 22468                                  ;
 22469                                  ;Note:
 22470                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22471                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22472                                  ;
 22473                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22474                                  ;
 22475                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22476                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22477                                  ;
 22478                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22479                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22480                                  ;
 22481                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22482                                  ;
 22483                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22484                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22485                                  ;
 22486                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22487                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22488                                  ;
 22489                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22490                                  ;
 22491                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22492                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22493                                  ;
 22494                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22495                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22496                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22497                                  ;
 22498                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22499                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22500                                  ;
 22501                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22502                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22503                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22504                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22505                                  
 22506                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22507                                  
 22508                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22509                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22510                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 22511                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 22512                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 22513                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 22514                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 22515                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 22516                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 22517                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 22518                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 22519                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 22520                                  
 22521                                  ;**** Function flags
 22522                                  
 22523                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 22524                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 22525                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 22526                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 22527                                  
 22528                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 22529                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 22530 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 22531 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 22532 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 22533 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 22534 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 22535 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 22536                                  endstruc
 22537                                  
 22538                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22539                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 22540                                  ;
 22541                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 22542                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 22543                                  ;	     +-
 22544                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 22545                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 22546                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 22547                                  ;	     |	:
 22548                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22549                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 22550                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 22551                                  ;	     |	:
 22552                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22553                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 22554                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 22555                                  ;	     +-	:
 22556                                  ;
 22557                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 22558                                  ;
 22559                                  ;Note:
 22560                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 22561                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 22562                                  ;
 22563                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22564                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22565                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22566                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22567                                  
 22568                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 22569                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 22570                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 22571                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 22572                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 22573                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 22574                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 22575                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 22576                                  
 22577                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 22578 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 22579 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 22580 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 22581 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 22582 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 22583                                  endstruc
 22584                                  
 22585                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22586                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 22587                                  ;
 22588                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 22589                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 22590                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 22591                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 22592                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 22593                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 22594                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 22595                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 22596                                  ;
 22597                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 22598                                  ;
 22599                                  ;            +-
 22600                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 22601                                  ;	    | or
 22602                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 22603                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 22604                                  ;	    | or
 22605                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 22606                                  ;	    | or
 22607                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 22608                                  ;	    | or
 22609                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 22610                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 22611                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 22612                                  ;	    | or
 22613                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 22614                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 22615                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 22616                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 22617                                  ;	    +-
 22618                                  ;
 22619                                  ;
 22620                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 22621                                  ;      list.
 22622                                  ;
 22623                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 22624                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 22625                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 22626                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22627                                  
 22628                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 22629                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 22630 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 22631 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 22632 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 22633 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 22634                                  endstruc

 22641                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index
 22642                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String
 22643                                  _$P_Complex	   equ	4		;AN000; Complex
 22644                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec

 22646                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 22647                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 22648                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String
 22649                                  
 22650                                  _$P_No_Tag	   equ	0FFh		;AN000; No ITEM_TAG found
 22651

 22653                                  ;

 22655

 22657                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 22658                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 22659                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 22660                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 22661                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 22662                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 22663                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 22664                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 22665                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 22672 0000143B 0000                    _$P_ORDINAL:	   dw	0		;AN000; Operand ordinal save area
 22673 0000143D 0000                    _$P_RC:		   dw	0		;AN000; Return code from parser
 22674 0000143F 0000                    _$P_SI_Save:	   dw	0		;AN000; Pointer of command buffer
 22675 00001441 0000                    _$P_DX:		   dw	0		;AN000; Return result buffer address
 22676 00001443 00                      _$P_Terminator:	   db	0		;AN000; Terminator code (ASCII)
 22677 00001444 0000                    _$P_DBCSEV_OFF:	   dw	0		;AN000; Offset of DBCS EV
 22678 00001446 0000                    _$P_DBCSEV_SEG:	   dw	0		;AN000; Segment of DBCS EV
 22679 00001448 0000                    _$P_Flags:	   dw	0		;AN000; Parser internal flags
 22680                                  %define _$P_Flags1 _$P_Flags		;AN038; to reference first byte flags
 22681                                  %define _$P_Flags2 _$P_Flags+1		;AN038; to reference second byte flags only
 22682                                  
 22683                                  ;in second byte of _$P_Flags, referenced as _$P_Flags2:
 22684                                  _$P_equ		   equ	01h	      ;AN000; "=" packed in string buffet
 22685                                  _$P_Neg		   equ	02h	      ;AN000; Negative value
 22686                                  _$P_Time12	   equ	04h	      ;AN000; set when PM is specified
 22687                                  _$P_Key_Cmp	   equ	08h	      ;AN000; set when keyword compare
 22688                                  _$P_SW_Cmp	   equ	10h	      ;AN000; set when switch compare
 22689                                  _$P_Extra	   equ	20h	      ;AN000; set when extra delimiter found
 22690                                  _$P_SW		   equ	40h	      ;AN000; set when switch found (tm08)
 22691                                  _$P_Signed	   equ	80h	      ;AN000; signed numeric specified
 22692
