 22749                                  ;***********************************************************************
 22750                                  ; SysParse;
 22751                                  ;
 22752                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 22753                                  ;
 22754                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 22755                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 22756                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 22757                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 22758                                  ;
 22759                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 22760                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 22761                                  ;		 is in DS.
 22762                                  ;
 22763                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 22764                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 22765                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 22766                                  ;
 22767                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 22768                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 22769                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 22770                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 22771                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 22772                                  ;
 22773                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 22774                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 22775                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 22776                                  ;
 22777                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 22778                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 22779                                  ;
 22780                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 22781                                  ;
 22782                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 22783                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 22784                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 22785                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 22786                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 22787                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 22788                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 22789                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 22790                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 22791                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 22792                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 22793                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 22794                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 22795                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 22796                                  ;	     (tm08)
 22797                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 22798                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 22799                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 22800                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 22801                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 22802                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 22803                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 22804                                  ;					  (tm12)
 22805                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 22806                                  ;					  (tm13)
 22807                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 22808                                  ;					  (tm14)
 22809                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 22810                                  ;					  (tm15)
 22811                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 22812                                  
 22813                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 22814                                  
 22815                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 22816                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 22817                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 22818                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 22819                                  
 22820                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 22821                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 22822                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 22823                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 22824                                  ;
 22825                                  
 22826                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 22827                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 22828                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 22829                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 22830                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 22831                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 22832                                  
 22833                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 22834                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 22835                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 22836                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 22837                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 22838                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 22839                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 22840                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 22841                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 22842                                  
 22843                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 22844                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 22845                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 22846                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 22847                                  ;	     segment.
 22848                                  
 22849                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 22850                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 22851                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 22852                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 22853                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 22854                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 22855                                  
 22856                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K
 22857                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro
 22858                                  ;	     invocations with their normally expanded code; made comments

 22866                                  ;	     A quoted text string can be framed only by double quote.  Remove

 22869                                  ;	     _$P_SQuote EQU also removed from PSDATA.INC.  Any references to
 22870                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.
 22871                                  
 22872                                  ;	     This fixes another bug, not mentioned in p1672, in that two
 22873                                  ;	     quote chars within a quoted string is supposed to be reported as
 22874                                  ;	     one quote character, but is reported as two quotes.  This changed
 22875                                  ;	     two instructions in PROC _$P_Quoted_Str.
 22876

 22878                                  ;	     have the SHORT operator to avoid the unneeded NOP.

 22954                                  ; The table of special chars _$P_FileSp_Char should be initialized on every
 22955                                  ;entry to SysParse. This is in the non-checksum region and any program that
 22956                                  ;corrupts this table but does not corrupt the checksum region will leave
 22957                                  ;command.com parsing in an inconsistent state.
 22958                                  ; NB: The special characters string has been hardcoded here. If any change
 22959                                  ;is made to it in psdata.inc, a corresponding change needs to be made here.
 22960

 22965 00001518 2EC706[DD14]3B3D        	mov 	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char+6], ';='
 22966                                  ;ENDIFtHHH

 23374                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23375                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23376                                  ;
 23377                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23378                                  ;
 23379                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23380                                  ;	    AL = type
 23381                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23382                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23383                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23384                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23385                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 23386                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths

 23388                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23389                                  ;
 23390                                  ; Output:   None
 23391                                  ;
 23392                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 23393                                  ;

 23395                                  ;***********************************************************************

 23409                                  _$P_RLT04:				;AN000;
 23410 0000173A 3C01                    	cmp	al,_$P_Number		;AN000; if number
 23411 0000173C 750A                    	jne	short _$P_RLT00		;AN000;
 23412                                  
 23413                                  _$P_RLT02:				;AN000;

 23764                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23765                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 23766                                  ;
 23767                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 23768                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 23769                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 23770                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 23771                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 23772                                  ;
 23773                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 23774                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23775                                  ;
 23776                                  ; Output:    None
 23777                                  ;
 23778                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 23779                                  ;
 23780                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 23781                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23782                                  
 23783                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23784                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 23785                                  
 23786                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 23787 000018DB 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 23788 000018DC 2E800E[4914]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 23789 000018E2 2E8026[4914]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 23790 000018E8 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 23791 000018EB 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 23792 000018ED 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 23793                                  
 23794 000018EF 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 23795 000018F1 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 23796                                  
 23797 000018F3 2E800E[4914]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 23798                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 23799 000018F9 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 23800                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 23801 000018FA E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 23802 000018FD 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 23803 000018FE C3                      	retn
 23804                                  
 23805                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23806                                  
 23807                                  	; 26/10/2022
 23808                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 23809 000018FF 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 23810 00001900 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 23811 00001901 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 23812 00001902 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 23813 00001903 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; cx = higher 16 bits
 23814 00001905 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 23815 00001907 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 23816                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;
 23817 00001908 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 23818 0000190B 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?
 23819 0000190D 7442                    	jz	short _$P_Value00	;AN000;

 23999                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 24000                                  ;
 24001                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 24002                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 24003                                  ;
 24004                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 24005                                  ;
 24006                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 24007                                  ;
 24008                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 24009                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24010                                  
 24011                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24012                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 24013 000019F0 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 24014 000019F1 2EF606[4914]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 24015 000019F7 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 24016                                  
 24017 000019F9 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 24018 000019FA C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24019                                  
 24020                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 24021 000019FB 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 24022 000019FC 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 24023                                  
 24024 000019FE F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 24025 000019FF C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 24026                                  
 24027                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 24028 00001A00 F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 24029 00001A01 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 24577 00001C03 3C0D                    	cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; Carriage return ?
 24578 00001C05 742D                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24579                                  
 24580 00001C07 3C00                    	cmp	al,_$P_NULL		;AN000; zero ?
 24581 00001C09 7429                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24582                                  
 24583                                  ;IF LFEOLSW				;AN028; IF LF TO BE ACCEPTED AS EOL
 24584 00001C0B 3C0A                    	cmp	al,_$P_LF		;AN000; Line feed ?
 24585 00001C0D 7425                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24586                                  ;ENDIF					;AN028;
 24587                                  
 24588 00001C0F 26807D0202              	cmp	byte [es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_EOL 
 24589                                  					;AN000; EOL character specified ?
 24590 00001C14 721E                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24591                                  
 24592 00001C16 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			;AN000;
 24593 00001C18 268A5D03                	mov	bl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim]
 24594                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 24595 00001C1C 83C304                  	add	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS 	;AN000; skip it
 24596 00001C1F 26803900                	cmp	byte [es:bx+di],_$P_I_Use_Default ;AN000; No extra EOL character ?
 24597 00001C23 740D                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ	;AN000;
 24598                                  
 24599                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000; Get number of extra character
 24600 00001C25 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 24601 00001C27 268A09                  	mov	cl,[es:bx+di]		;AN000;
 24602                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Loop:			;AN000;
 24603 00001C2A 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 24604 00001C2B 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra EOL character
 24605 00001C2E 7404                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24606                                  
 24607 00001C30 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_EOL_Loop 	;AN000;
 24608                                  
 24609                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ:				;AN000;
 24610 00001C32 3C0D                    	cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; reset ZF
 24611                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit:			;AN000;
 24612 00001C34 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24613 00001C35 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 24614 00001C36 C3                      	retn
 24615                                  
 24616                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24617                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 24618                                  ;
 24619                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 24620                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 24621                                  ;	    blanks.
 24622                                  ;
 24623                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24624                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 24625                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 24626                                  ;
 24627                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 24628                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 24629                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 24630                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24631                                  
 24632                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 24633 00001C37 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 24634 00001C38 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24635 00001C39 2EC606[4314]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 24636                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 24637                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 24638 00001C3F 2E8026[4914]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 24639 00001C45 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 24640 00001C47 7436                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24641                                  
 24642 00001C49 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 24643 00001C4B 7432                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24644                                  
 24645 00001C4D 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 24646 00001C4F 7431                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 24647                                  
 24648                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 24649                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 24650 00001C51 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 24651 00001C53 750C                    	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 24652                                  
 24653 00001C55 803C20                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 24654 00001C58 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 24655                                  
 24656 00001C5A B020                    	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 24657 00001C5C 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 24658 00001C5D 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 24659 00001C5F EB1E                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24660                                  
 24661                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 24662 00001C61 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 24663                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 24664 00001C66 7217                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24665                                  
 24666                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 24667 00001C68 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 24668                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 24669 00001C6A 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 24670                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 24671 00001C6E 09C9                    	or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 24672 00001C70 740B                    	jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 24673                                  
 24674 00001C72 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 24675                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 24676 00001C75 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 24677 00001C76 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 24678 00001C79 7407                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 24679                                  
 24680 00001C7B E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 24681                                  
 24682                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 24683 00001C7D 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 24684                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 24685                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 24686 00001C7F 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24687 00001C80 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 24688 00001C81 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24689                                  
 24690                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 24691 00001C82 2EA2[4314]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 24692 00001C86 2EF606[4914]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 24693 00001C8C 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 24694                                  
 24695 00001C8E 2E800E[4914]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 24696                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 24697                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 24698 00001C94 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 24699 00001C96 EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24700                                  
 24701                                  
 24702                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24703                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 24704                                  ;
 24705                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 24706                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 24707                                  ;
 24708                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24709                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 24710                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 24711                                  ;
 24712                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 24713                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 24714                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 24715                                  
 24716                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 24717                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 24718                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 24719                                  ;
 24720                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 24721                                  
 24722                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 24723                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24724                                  
 24725                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 24726                                  	;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 24727 00001C98 8D2E[5214]              	lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	; BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 24728                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 24729 00001C9C 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 24730 00001C9E 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 24731                                  
 24732                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 24733 00001CA0 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24734 00001CA2 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 24735                                  
 24736 00001CA4 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 24737                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24738                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24739 00001CA5 C3                      	retn
 24740                                  
 24741                                  ; 12/12/2022
 24742                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 24743                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 24744                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24745                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 24746                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24747                                  
 24748                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 24749                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 24750 00001CA6 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24751 00001CA8 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 24752                                  
 24753 00001CAA 2E800E[4914]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 24754                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24755                                  
 24756                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24757                                  	; cf=0
 24758                                  	;retn
 24759                                  
 24760                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 24761                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24762                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 24763 00001CB0 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 24764                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 24765                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 24766 00001CB1 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24767                                  
 24768                                  ;**************************************************************************
 24769                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24770                                  ;
 24771                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 24772                                  ;
 24773                                  ;  Input:
 24774                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 24775                                  ;
 24776                                  ;  Output:
 24777                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 24778                                  ;
 24779                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 24780                                  ;
 24781                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 24782                                  ;***************************************************************************
 24783                                  
 24784                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24785 00001CB2 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 24786 00001CB3 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 24787 00001CB4 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24788                                  	
 24789 00001CB5 2E833E[4614]00          	cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 24790 00001CBB 7527                    	jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 24791                                  
 24792 00001CBD 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24793 00001CBE 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24794 00001CBF 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24795 00001CC0 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 24796 00001CC1 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 24797 00001CC2 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 24798 00001CC3 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 24799 00001CC4 31F6                    	xor	si,si			;AN000;
 24800 00001CC6 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si			;AN000;
 24801 00001CC8 B80063                  	MOV	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 24802 00001CCB CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 24803                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 24804 00001CCD 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24805 00001CCF 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24806 00001CD1 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 24807 00001CD2 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 24808 00001CD3 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 24809 00001CD4 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 24810 00001CD5 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24811 00001CD6 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24812 00001CD7 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24813 00001CD8 7429                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 24814                                  
 24815                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 24816 00001CDA 2E8936[4414]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 24817 00001CDF 2E891E[4614]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 24818                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 24819 00001CE4 2E8B36[4414]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 24820 00001CE9 2E8E1E[4614]            	mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 24821                                  
 24822                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 24823 00001CEE 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 24824 00001CF1 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 24825                                  
 24826 00001CF3 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 24827 00001CF5 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 24828                                  
 24829 00001CF7 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 24830 00001CFA 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 24831                                  
 24832 00001CFC F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 24833 00001CFD EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 24834                                  
 24835                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 24836 00001CFF 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 24837 00001D00 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 24838                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 24839 00001D01 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 24840                                  
 24841                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 24842                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24843                                  	; cf=0
 24844                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 24845                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 24846 00001D03 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24847 00001D04 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 24848 00001D05 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 24849 00001D06 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25401                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 25402                                  
 25403                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 25404                                  
 25405                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25406                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25407                                  
 25408                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 25409                                  ;
 25410                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 25411                                  ;
 25412                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25413                                  ;
 25414                                  ;   Modification log:
 25415                                  ;
 25416                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 25417                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 25418                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 25419                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 25420                                  ;
 25421                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25422                                  ;
 25423                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 25424                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 25425                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 25426                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 25427                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 25428                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 25429                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 25430                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 25431                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 25432                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 25433                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 25434                                  ;
 25435                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25436                                  
 25437                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 25438                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 25439                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 25440                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 25441                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 25442                                  
 25443                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 25444                                  
 25445                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 25446                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 25447                                  
 25448                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 25449                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 25450                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 25451                                  
 25452                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 25453                                  ;
 25454                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 25455                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 25456                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 25457                                  ;	           line.
 25458                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 25459                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 25460                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 25461                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 25462                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 25463                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 25464                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 25465                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 25466                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 25467                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 25468                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 25469                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 25470                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 25471                                  ;	           for details).
 25472                                  
 25473                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 25474                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 25475                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 25476                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 25477                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 25478                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 25479                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 25480                                  fm_strat: db	0
 25481                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 25482                                  
 25483                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 25484                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 25485                                  
 25486                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 25487                                  
 25488                                  %endif

 25500 00001EEA 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 25501 00001EEC 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded

 25510 00001EFB 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 25511 00001EFD 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)

 25595                                  
 25596                                  	;mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 25597                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25598 00001F4E 8B16[A102]              	mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 25599                                  
 25600 00001F52 A1[D203]                	mov	ax,[count]
 25601 00001F55 A3[4C03]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 25602 00001F58 E866F1                  	call	ParaRound
 25603 00001F5B 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 25604                                  
 25605                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25606                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25607                                  ;;
 25608                                  ;;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 25609                                  ;;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 25610                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 25611                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 25612                                  ;;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 25613                                  ;;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 25614                                  ;;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 25615                                  ;;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 25616                                  ;;
 25617                                  ;       dec     dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 25618                                  ;       mov     [config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 25619                                  ;       sub     dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 25620                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 25621                                  
 25622 00001F5D 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 25623                                  	
 25624                                  	;mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 25625                                  	;mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 25626                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25627 00001F60 8916[A102]              	mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 25628 00001F64 E870EC                  	call    TempCDS 
 25629                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25630                                  	; ds <> cs 
 25631 00001F67 2E8B16[A102]            	mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 25632                                   
 25633 00001F6C 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 25634 00001F6E 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 25635                                  
 25636 00001F70 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25637 00001F72 2E8B0E[D203]            	mov	cx,[cs:count]
 25638 00001F77 B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 25639                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 25640 00001F79 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 25641 00001F7A CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 25642 00001F7C 9C                      	pushf
 25643                                  
 25644                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 25645                                  
 25646 00001F7D 50                      	push	ax
 25647 00001F7E 57                      	push	di
 25648 00001F7F 51                      	push	cx
 25649 00001F80 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 25650 00001F82 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 25651 00001F84 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 25652 00001F86 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 25653 00001F88 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 25654                                  
 25655                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 25656                                  
 25657 00001F8A 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 25658                                  
 25659                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 25660                                  
 25661                                  puteol:
 25662 00001F8B B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 25663 00001F8D AA                      	stosb
 25664 00001F8E B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 25665 00001F90 AA                      	stosb
 25666 00001F91 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 25667                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25668                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 25669                                  
 25670                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 25671                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25672 00001F93 0E                      	push	cs
 25673 00001F94 1F                      	pop	ds
 25674                                  
 25675 00001F95 893E[D203]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 25676                                  
 25677 00001F99 59                      	pop	cx
 25678 00001F9A 5F                      	pop	di
 25679 00001F9B 58                      	pop	ax
 25680                                  
 25681                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25682                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25683                                  	;push	cs
 25684                                  	;pop	ds
 25685                                  
 25686 00001F9C 50                      	push	ax
 25687                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 25688 00001F9D B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 25689 00001F9F CD21                    	int	21h
 25690 00001FA1 58                      	pop	ax
 25691 00001FA2 9D                      	popf
 25692 00001FA3 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 25693 00001FA5 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 25694 00001FA7 742C                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 25695                                  conferr:
 25696 00001FA9 BA[7C34]                	mov	dx,config		;want to print config error
 25697 00001FAC E8AC13                  	call	badfil
 25698                                  endconv:
 25699 00001FAF C3                      	retn
 25700                                  
 25701                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25702                                  ;
 25703                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 25704                                  ;
 25705                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands
 25706                                  ;
 25707                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25708                                  
 25709                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25710                                  multi_pass:
 25711 00001FB0 0E                      	push	cs
 25712 00001FB1 1F                      	pop	ds
 25713                                  
 25714 00001FB2 803E[4903]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 25715                                  ;jae_endconv:
 25716 00001FB7 73F6                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 25717                                  
 25718                                  	;push	word [CONFBOT]
 25719                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25720 00001FB9 FF36[A102]              	push	word [top_of_cdss]
 25721 00001FBD 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 25722                                  
 25723 00001FBE 8B36[D403]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 25724 00001FC2 8936[D203]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 25725 00001FC6 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 25726 00001FC8 8936[D603]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 25727 00001FCC 8936[2B03]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 25728                                  
 25729 00001FD0 E86807                  	call	getchr
 25730 00001FD3 EB06                    	jmp	short conflp
 25731                                  
 25732                                  getcom:
 25733 00001FD5 E8B10E                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 25734 00001FD8 E86007                  	call	getchr
 25735                                  conflp: 
 25736 00001FDB 72D2                    	jc	short endconv
 25737                                  
 25738 00001FDD FF06[2B03]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 25739                                  
 25740 00001FE1 C606[3314]00            	mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 25741 00001FE6 C606[3614]00            	mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 25742 00001FEB 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 25743 00001FED 7416                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 25744                                  
 25745                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25746                                  %if 0
 25747                                  
 25748                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25749                                  
 25750                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 25751                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 25752                                  
 25753                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 25754                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 25755                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 25756                                          cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 25757                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 25758                                  
 25759                                          push    ax                      ;
 25760                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 25761                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 25762                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 25763                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 25764                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 25765                                          pop     ax
 25766                                  ;
 25767                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 25768                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 25769                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 25770                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 25771                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 25772                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 25773                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 25774                                  ;   spot.
 25775                                  ;
 25776                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 25777                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 25778                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 25779                                  ;   retrieved.
 25780                                  ;
 25781                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 25782                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 25783                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 25784                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25785                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 25786                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 25787                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 25788                                  final:                                  ;
 25789                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 25790                                  not_final:                              ;
 25791                                  ;endif
 25792                                  
 25793                                  %endif
 25794 00001FEF 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 25795 00001FF1 E84707                  	call	getchr
 25796 00001FF4 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 25797                                  
 25798 00001FF6 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 25799                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 25800                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25801 00001FFB 73B2                    	jnb	short endconv	
 25802 00001FFD E90707                  	jmp	badop
 25803                                  	
 25804                                  coff:	
 25805                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25806                                  	; ds = cs
 25807                                  	;push	cs
 25808                                  	;pop	ds
 25809 00002000 E89D10                  	call	newline
 25810 00002003 EBD6                    	jmp	short conflp	; 13/05/2019
 25811                                  
 25812                                  blank_line:
 25813 00002005 E83307                  	call	getchr
 25814 00002008 EBD1                    	jmp	short conflp
 25815                                  
 25816                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25817                                  ; 11/12/2022
 25818                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 25819                                  ;coff_p:
 25820                                  	;push	cs
 25821                                  	;pop	ds
 25822                                  
 25823                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 25824                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 25825                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 25826                                  ;install= command.
 25827                                  
 25828                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25829                                  ;install command
 25830                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25831                                  
 25832                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25833                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 25834                                  tryi:
 25835 0000200A 803E[4903]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 25836 0000200F 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 25837 00002011 E92301                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 25838                                  not_init_pass:
 25839 00002014 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 25840                                          ; 11/12/2022
 25841                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 25842 00002019 74E5                    	je	short coff
 25843                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25844                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 25845                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 25846                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 25847                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 25848                                  					; and before install= commands
 25849                                  					; are processed
 25850                                  
 25851 0000201B 803E[4903]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 25852 00002020 7411                    	je	short multi_try_i
 25853 00002022 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 25854                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25855                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 25856 00002025 74D9                    	je	short coff
 25857                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25858                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 25859                                  
 25860                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 25861                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 25862                                          
 25863 00002027 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 25864                                  	;jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 25865                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25866 0000202A 752A                    	jne	short tryb	
 25867                                  	
 25868                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; set the flag
 25869 0000202C 800E[4A03]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25870                                  multi_pass_coff2:
 25871 00002031 EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 25872                                  
 25873                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25874                                  ;precheck_installhigh:
 25875                                  ;       cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH
 25876                                  ;       jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing
 25877                                  ;	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 25878                                  ;	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25879                                  ;       jmp	short coff
 25880                                  
 25881                                  multi_try_i:
 25882 00002033 80FC49                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I' ; install= command?
 25883                                  	;jne	short multi_try_n	; no, check for installhigh
 25884                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25885 00002036 7505                    	jne	short multi_pass_filter
 25886                                  
 25887                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25888                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25889                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 25890                                  ;       jc	short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 25891                                  ;;endif
 25892                                  
 25893 00002038 E806F0                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 25894 0000203B EBC3                    	jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 25895                                  
 25896                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25897                                  %if 0
 25898                                  
 25899                                  multi_try_n:
 25900                                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 25901                                          jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 25902                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25903                                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 25904                                          jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 25905                                  ;endif
 25906                                  
 25907                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 25908                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 25909                                  
 25910                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|0 ; 5800h
 25911                                  	int	21h			;get alloc strategy
 25912                                  	mov	bx,ax
 25913                                          push    bx                      ; save for the return
 25914                                  
 25915                                          or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst
 25916                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h
 25917                                  	int	21h			;set alloc strategy
 25918                                  
 25919                                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 25920                                          int     21h                     ; get link state
 25921                                          xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 25922                                          push    ax                      ; save for return
 25923                                  
 25924                                          mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3 ; 5803h
 25925                                  	mov	bx,1
 25926                                  	int	21h			;link in UMBs
 25927                                  
 25928                                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 25929                                  
 25930                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 25931                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 25932                                          int     21h
 25933                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy
 25934                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1
 25935                                          int     21h
 25936                                  
 25937                                  	jmp	coff			;to handle next install= command.
 25938                                  
 25939                                  %endif
 25940                                  
 25941                                  multi_pass_filter:
 25942 0000203D 80FC59                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_COMMENT ; 'Y' ; comment?
 25943 00002040 740A                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 25944 00002042 80FC5A                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_UNKNOWN ; 'Z' ; bad command?
 25945 00002045 7405                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 25946 00002047 80FC30                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_REM  ; '0' 	; rem?
 25947 0000204A 7508                    	jne	short multi_pass_coff 	; ignore the rest of the commands.
 25948

 25961                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25962                                  ;									      *
 25963                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 25964                                  ;									      *
 25965                                  ; input :								      *
 25966                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 25967                                  ; output:								      *
 25968                                  ;	buffers set							      *

 25971                                  ;									      *

 25987                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *

 27508                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27509                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 27510                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 27511                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 27512                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 27513                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 27514                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 27515                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 27516                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27517                                  
 27518                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27519                                  ;									  *
 27520                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 27521                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 27522                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 27523                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 27524                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 27525                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 27526                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 27527                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 27528                                  ; input :								  *
 27529                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 27530                                  ; output:								  *
 27531                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 27532                                  ;									  *
 27533                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 27534                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 27535                                  ; logic:								  *
 27536                                  ; {									  *
 27537                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 27538                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 27539                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 27540                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 27541                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 27542                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 27543                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27544                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 27545                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27546                                  ;	     }								  *
 27547                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 27548                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 27549                                  ;	};								  *
 27550                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 27551                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 27552                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 27553                                  ; };									  *
 27554                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27555

 27863                                  
 27864                                  ;************************************************************************
 27865                                  ; function: parse the parameters of fcbs= command.			*
 27866                                  ;									*
 27867                                  ; input :								*
 27868                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				*
 27869                                  ; output:								*
 27870                                  ;	set the variables fcbs,keep.					*
 27871                                  ;									*
 27872                                  ; subroutines to be called:						*
 27873                                  ;	sysinit_parse							*
 27874                                  ; logic:								*
 27875                                  ; {									*
 27876                                  ;	set di points to fcbs_parms;					*
 27877                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						*
 27878                                  ;	while (end of command line)					*
 27879                                  ;	{ sysparse;							*

 28223                                  sysinit_parse:
 28224                                  
 28225                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28226                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 28227                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 28228                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 28229                                  ;
 28230                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 28231                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 28232                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 28233                                  ;	*** after each call.
 28234                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 28235                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 28236                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 28237                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 28238                                  ;	 procedure.
 28239                                  ;	ax - exit code
 28240                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 28241                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 28242                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 28243                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer

 28246                                  	; 24/10/2022
