 29718                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29719                                  
 29720                                  convUMB:
 29721                                  	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 29722                                  	jne	short cu10	; If it didn't read in hex, it's not an address
 29723                                  	call	AddrToUmb	; Else, convert the address to a UMB number
 29724                                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 29725                                  	jne	short cu10
 29726                                  	inc	ax		; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 29727                                  cu10:	
 29728                                  	retn
 29729                                  
 29730                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29731                                  ;*** setUMBs - links umbs and sets allocation strategy for a load
 29732                                  ;            -- if LoadHigh, the allocation strategy MAY be LOW_FIRST instead
 29733                                  ; of the usual HIGH_FIRST.  See the code.
 29734                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29735                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 29736                                  ; EXIT:   None
 29737                                  ; ERROR:  None
 29738                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 29739                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29740                                  
 29741                                  setUMBs:
 29742                                  	push	ax
 29743                                  	push	bx
 29744                                  	call	fm_link
 29745                                  	pop	bx
 29746                                  	pop	ax
 29747                                  	retn
 29748                                  
 29749                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29750                                  ;*** loadLow - returns AL==0 if UMB0 == 0, else AL==1
 29751                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29752                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 29753                                  ; EXIT:   AL==0 if mem strategy should be set to LOW_FIRST, else AL==1
 29754                                  ;         Carry set if UMB0 not specified (_NOT_ an error)
 29755                                  ; ERROR:  None
 29756                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 29757                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29758                                  ; We want to set the memory strategy to LOW_FIRST if the user specified a
 29759                                  ; load UMB, and it is 0.  That 0 can be either from the user having _specified_
 29760                                  ; zero (/L:0;...), or from having specified a too-big min size (/L:1,99999999)
 29761                                  ; such that the load UMB is too small, and shouldn't be used.
 29762                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29763                                  
 29764                                  loadLow:
 29765                                  	;push	ds
 29766                                  	;push	cs		; Point DS into appropriate data segment
 29767                                  	;pop	ds	
 29768                                  
 29769                                  	;mov	al,[UmbLoad]
 29770                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad]
 29771                                  	cmp	al,UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh, -1
 29772                                  	jne	short ll10
 29773                                  
 29774                                  	stc
 29775                                  ll15:
 29776                                  	mov	al,1		; Return with AL==1 && STC if no UMBs specified
 29777                                  	;stc
 29778                                  	;jmp	short llX
 29779                                  	retn
 29780                                  ll10:	
 29781                                  	or	al,al		; AL=the load UMB: Is it == 0?
 29782                                  	;jz	short llX	; Yep... CF==0 (from OR) && AL=0, so just exit
 29783                                  
 29784                                  	jnz	short ll15	; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29785                                  	retn
 29786                                  
 29787                                  	;mov	al,1
 29788                                  	;clc
 29789                                  ;llX:
 29790                                  	;pop	ds		; Return DS to where it was
 29791                                  	;retn
 29792                                  
 29793                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29794                                  ;*** HideUMBs - links UMBs and hides upper-memory as appropriate
 29795                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29796                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 29797                                  ; EXIT:   None
 29798                                  ; ERROR:  None
 29799                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 29800                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29801                                  
 29802                                  HideUMBs:
 29803                                  	push	ax
 29804                                  	push	cx
 29805                                  	push	ds
 29806                                  	push	es
 29807                                  
 29808                                  	call	UmbTest		; See if we REALLY linked in anything...
 29809                                  	jc	short husX	; ...if not, there's nothing for us to do.
 29810                                  
 29811                                  	call	FixMem		; Concatenate adjacent free MCBs in upper mem
 29812                                  	call	setUMBs		; Link UMBs and set memory-allocation strategy
 29813                                  
 29814                                  	;putdata fInHigh,1	; Remember that we're now running high
 29815                                  	mov	byte [cs:fInHigh],1
 29816                                  
 29817                                  	;call	GetLoadUMB	; See if they gave us a list to leave free
 29818                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad] ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29819                                  
 29820                                  	cmp	al,UNSPECIFIED	; If they didn't,
 29821                                  	je	short husX	; then we shouldn't do this loop:
 29822                                  
 29823                                  	xor	cx,cx
 29824                                  
 29825                                  ; -----------------------------------------------
 29826                                  ; HUS10-CX - UMB number (after inc, 1==first UMB)
 29827                                  ; -----------------------------------------------
 29828                                  
 29829                                  hus10:	inc	cx		; For each UMB:
 29830                                  	cmp	cx,MAXUMB ; 16
 29831                                  	jae	short hus20
 29832                                  
 29833                                  	mov	al,cl		; (stopping as soon as we're outside of the
 29834                                  	push	es
 29835                                  	call	findUMB		; valid range of UMBs)
 29836                                  	pop	es		; push/pop: trash what findumb finds.  :-)
 29837                                  	jc	short hus20
 29838                                  
 29839                                  	call	_hideUMB_	; hide what we need to hide.
 29840                                  
 29841                                  	jmp	short hus10
 29842                                  hus20:	
 29843                                  	;call	GetLoadUMB	; Now check if they offered /L:0
 29844                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad] ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 29845                                  
 29846                                  	or	al,al		; --Is the load UMB 0? (-1==unspecified)
 29847                                  	jnz	short husX	; If not, we're done.
 29848                                  
 29849                                  	call	hl_unlink	; If so, however, fix UMBs and strategy.
 29850                                  husX:	
 29851                                  	pop	es
 29852                                  	pop	ds
 29853                                  	pop	cx
 29854                                  	pop	ax
 29855                                  	retn
 29856                                  
 29857                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29858                                  ;*** GetLoadUMB - Returns the load UMB number in AL (-1 if not specified)
 29859                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29860                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 29861                                  ; EXIT:   AL == load UMB
 29862                                  ; ERROR:  None
 29863                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 29864                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29865                                  
 29866                                  ;GetLoadUMB:
 29867                                  ;	;getdata al, UmbLoad
 29868                                  ;	push	ds
 29869                                  ;	push	cs
 29870                                  ;	pop	ds
 29871                                  ;	mov	al,[UmLoad]

 29873                                  ;	retn
 29874                                  
 29875                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29876                                  ;*** GetLoadSize - Returns the load UMB minimum size (0 if not specified)
 29877                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29878                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 29879                                  ; EXIT:   AX == load UMB minimum size
 29880                                  ; ERROR:  None
 29881                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 29882                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29883                                  
 29884                                  GetLoadSize:
 29885                                  	; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29886                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad]
 29887                                  	jmp	short GetSize
 29888                                  
 29889                                  	;push	bx
 29890                                  	;;push	si
 29891                                  	;push	ds
 29892                                  	;push	cs
 29893                                  	;pop	ds
 29894                                  
 29895                                  	;mov	al,[UmbLoad]
 29896                                  
 29897                                  	;xor	ah,ah			;    ax==UMB
 29898                                  	;mov	bx,UmbSize		;    bx==array
 29899                                  	;shl	al,1	                ;    ax==offset
 29900                                  	;;add	ax,bx			;    ax==element index
 29901                                  	;;mov	si,ax			; ds:si==element index
 29902                                  
 29903                                  	;;lodsw				;    ax==size
 29904                                  
 29905                                  	;add	bx,ax
 29906                                  	;mov	ax,[bx]
 29907                                  
 29908                                  	;pop	ds
 29909                                  	;;pop	si
 29910                                  	;pop	bx
 29911                                  	;retn
 29912                                  
 29913                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29914                                  ;*** GetSize - Returns the UMB in AL's minimum size (0 if not specified)
 29915                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29916                                  ; ENTRY:  AL == a UMB number
 29917                                  ; EXIT:   AX == UMB minimum size, as specified by the user
 29918                                  ; ERROR:  None
 29919                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 29920                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29921                                  
 29922                                  GetSize:
 29923                                  	; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29924                                  
 29925                                  	push	bx
 29926                                  	;push	si
 29927                                  	;push	ds
 29928                                  	;push	cs
 29929                                  	;pop	ds
 29930                                  
 29931                                  	xor	ah,ah			;    ax==UMB
 29932                                  	mov	bx,UmbSize		;    bx==array
 29933                                  	shl	al,1	                ;    ax==offset
 29934                                  	;add	ax,bx			;    ax==element index
 29935                                  	;mov	si,ax			; ds:si==element index
 29936                                  
 29937                                  	;lodsw				;    ax==size
 29938                                  
 29939                                  	add	bx,ax
 29940                                  	;mov	ax,[bx]
 29941                                  	mov	ax,[cs:bx]
 29942                                  
 29943                                  	;pop	ds
 29944                                  	;pop	si
 29945                                  	pop	bx
 29946                                  	retn
 29947                                  
 29948                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29949                                  ;*** StoLoadUMB - Overrides the load UMB number with what's in AL
 29950                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29951                                  ; ENTRY:   AL == new load UMB
 29952                                  ; EXIT:    None
 29953                                  ; ERROR:   None
 29954                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX
 29955                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29956                                  ; CAUTION: Should only be used if /L:... was used.  Logically, that is the only
 29957                                  ;          time you would ever need this, so that's okay.
 29958                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29959                                  
 29960                                  ;StoLoadUMB:

 29962                                  ;	push	es
 29963                                  ;	push	cs

 29965                                  ;	mov	[es:UmbLoad],al
 29966                                  ;	pop	es
 29967                                  ;	retn
 29968                                  
 29969                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29970                                  ;*** StoLoadSize - Overrides the load UMB minimum size with what's in AX
 29971                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29972                                  ; ENTRY:  AL == new load size
 29973                                  ; EXIT:   None
 29974                                  ; ERROR:  None
 29975                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 29976                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29977                                  
 29978                                  StoLoadSize:
 29979                                  	push	dx
 29980                                  
 29981                                  	;getdata dl, UmbLoad		; Put UMB# in DL and size in AX
 29982                                  	;
 29983                                  	;push	ds
 29984                                  	;push	cs
 29985                                  	;pop	ds
 29986                                  	;mov	dl,[UmbLoad]
 29987                                  	;pop	ds	
 29988                                  
 29989                                  	mov	dl,[cs:UmbLoad]
 29990                                  
 29991                                  	cmp	dl,UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 29992                                  	je	short sls10
 29993                                  
 29994                                  	call	stowSiz			; We've got a function to do just this
 29995                                  sls10:	
 29996                                  	pop	dx
